Jurassic World Dominion offered a different but enjoyable twist to the usual direction taken in the franchise. The impossible notion that dinosuars are something that can be introduced to everyday life is what makes the film truly unique. Aswell as this, it removes the thrill of seeing the dinosaurs because we've become accustomed to them after multiple movies. It is difficult to keep the enthusiasm everyone held for the first film once you repeat the same formula again and again. As far as I'm concerned, they just about pulled it off. The only reason I managed to find a little enjoyment out of the movie was because I was surrounded by friends who were genuine cowards. Personally I wouldn't watch again, but I'm glad I did with the people I did.

Wow, foiled again, a movie from my youth gets a long awaited follow up, it has a great cast, with some familiar faces, a big budget, so there's action galore, and some wonderful music, but a plot..... a plot that could have been written by a random stranger walking past the studio.How on Earth is it possible for such a film to feel so vacuous, so empty, this film made me feel nothing, other than boredom. ¬£40 that could have been used on so many other things.It's not ok these days to simply try and dazzle us with some awesome visuals, there needs to be some sort of plot, but there just isn't one, in simplistic terms it asks if man can live with dinosaurs, but of course you know what's going to happen. Some of the visuals are great, epic, some scenes though....did they run out of time?Chris Pratt, didn't do it for me, the old cast tried, but it felt hollow.Like the dinosaurs themselves, this franchise should have been left in the past. 3/10.

Jurassic World: Dominion is a step up from some of it's immediate predecessors. The plot consists of two stretched out intertwining arcs which separate the original cast from the more recently introduced characters. The film does not fail to deliver, for what it's worth, entertainment. However it's a few dinosaur steps down from the franchises legendary start.

Life once found a way. Now, I hope it loses itself.Jurassic World Dominion has its positives, namely the fantastic Legacy character's wonderful return and, well, that's it. I enjoyed their presence, especially Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum - the latter who had the best lines, as always. The rest...yeah, I sincerely hope this is the last Jurassic Anything.All throughout this movie, the word "Dumb" just kept popping up in my head. Dumb script. Dumb dialogue. Dumb luck with all the hilariously impossible coincidences. Too many Dumb references to this series and other Steven Spielberg classics. And the two Dumbest characters in the franchise are back: Clone Girl Maisie who hates all mankind for her decision in the last entry and that screaming boy, Franklin, though, THANK GOD, he doesn't scream in this one like all the scenes he ruined in the last one.With a huge missed opportunity to expand on the actual title of Jurassic World, this hopefully last chapter just has society dealing with dinos killing people and the economy while debating if they should be extinguished. But, never mind that, this series has always been around greed and the ineptest baddie of the franchise with the most hilariously bad security detail is up to no good and only our 1,500 heroes in this movie can stop him!While the second half is monstrously better than the first half, I still couldn't wait for this movie to be over. Sure, it's better than the two worst sequels: III and Fallen Kingdom, but not by much. Like the Terminator, this franchise should've stopped at #2 in The Lost World.The movie's absolutely boring, even with multiple action scenes and there are literally no stakes. In fact, I was always hoping throughout the first two acts, they'd have the balls to kill off any of the characters. As much as I would love to see the Legacy characters make it - forgetting about the new Jurassic World characters, never liked them much - at least the movie would've taken chances.I'm done with this series. Like Transformers 4 and Pirates of the Caribbean 4, even if they make another one (like they did with those franchises,) I won't be watching another one. This was just crap.***Final Thoughts: Easy listing of the Series. Hint: Only watch the 1st three listed below.1. Jurassic Park2. The Lost World: Jurassic Park3. Jurassic World97. Jurassic World Dominion98. Jurassic Park III99. Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom.

It's four years after Isla Nublar. Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Deering (Bryce Dallas Howard) are hiding Maisie from the world. Dinosaurs are roaming the world. Biosyn is a genetics company run by Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) and given the legal rights over them. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) suspects them of reviving an ancient locust which threatens the world food supply. She recruits a reluctant Alan Grant (Sam Neill) to help. They have Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) as their inside man.The franchise is trying to bring together the newer iteration with the original three. Filmmaker Colin Trevorrow seems to be in charge. His success rate is mixed. He has a tendency not to recognize when his films get into awkward positions. In this one, there is a lot of convenient coincidences. There is one section when I'm yelling at the characters to shoot. They have guns and I don't think dinosaurs are bulletproof. I question the world building exercise here. Some of it is silly. I don't mind bringing back the original three. I like continuing their stories and visiting old friends. There is a lot going on with the two sides and I wouldn't mind if they could be connected more smoothly. They only run into the other group because they are both coming after the company. Instead of turning Chris Pratt into Bourne Identity, they could identify Biosyn early on and zero in on Ian Malcolm as their way in. They could be the people to recruit Ellie and Alan. It's a more natural way to connect the two groups. While I love the idea of the locust, I don't understand why they got released. It's a messy movie. This is a lot. It's overloaded. Some of it is fun and I can hold on to that.

The first Jurassic Park was a classic, this one is not even close.The scriptwriting and directing were atrocious - how could they release such an unfinished product? It's painful to watch now that I've seen it all in person because there are some truly cringe worthy moments where you can't help but say "wow...they really missed the mark".Can't believe I wasted three hours of my life watching this garbage. The acting was terrible, the plot was nonsensical, and the special effects were laughably bad.2022 is shaping up to be a pretty terrible year for movies. This has got to be the worst one yet!

Amazing to see the original cast back in action, they nail their roles and paired well with the new leads. A few decent newcomers to the cast as well. However, the storyline is tired - all of it been there done that, from the dinosaur fights to genetics, nothing new.

Jurassic World Dominion, the sixth installment in the Jurassic Park franchise, brings the prehistoric saga to a close, or at least a chapter's end, by exploring the precarious coexistence of humans and dinosaurs in a world where the lines between predator and prey have become increasingly blurred. Directed by Colin Trevorrow, who also helmed Jurassic World, the film attempts to tie together loose ends from previous installments while introducing new threats and ethical dilemmas.Dominion picks up several years after the events of Fallen Kingdom, where dinosaurs have escaped into the wild and are now scattered across the globe. The narrative is split into two primary storylines. One follows Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) as they strive to protect Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon), a cloned human with unique genetic significance, from those who wish to exploit her. Their journey intertwines with the efforts of Dr. Alan Grant (Sam Neill), Dr. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), and Dr. Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum), who are investigating the genetically modified locusts created by Biosyn Genetics, a powerful corporation with nefarious intentions.Biosyn, led by the ambitious and morally ambiguous CEO Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott), plays a central role in Dominion. Dodgson's plan to control the world's food supply using his engineered locusts, while simultaneously studying dinosaurs for potential medical advancements, creates a dangerous and ethically murky landscape. The film raises pertinent questions about genetic manipulation, corporate greed, and the potential consequences of playing God.The film's visual effects are, as expected, spectacular. The dinosaurs are rendered with impressive realism, and the action sequences, particularly those involving the larger predatory species, are thrilling. The variety of dinosaurs showcased is also a highlight, with some new and visually striking creatures making their franchise debut. However, the sheer number of dinosaurs and the constant barrage of action sometimes overshadow the narrative and character development.One of the most anticipated aspects of Dominion was the return of the original Jurassic Park trio. While their presence adds a nostalgic element and their characters are given moments to shine, their integration into the main plot feels somewhat forced. Their storyline, while connected to the larger narrative, could have been more seamlessly woven into the primary plot involving Owen, Claire, and Maisie.Dominion attempts to address the long-standing theme of humanity's responsibility towards the natural world and the consequences of its actions. The film underscores the dangers of unchecked scientific ambition and the potential for ecological disaster when powerful forces prioritize profit over preservation. However, these themes, while present, are not explored with the depth they deserve. The film often prioritizes spectacle over substance, leaving some of the more complex ethical questions raised by the narrative underdeveloped.Despite its flaws, Jurassic World Dominion offers a visually impressive and action-packed conclusion to the Jurassic Park saga. It provides a sense of closure for long-time fans of the franchise, even if that closure feels somewhat rushed and superficial. The film's exploration of a world where dinosaurs and humans must coexist, while intriguing, ultimately falls short of its potential. While Dominion delivers thrilling dinosaur encounters and nostalgic moments, it ultimately fails to fully grapple with the complex ethical and ecological questions it raises, leaving the future of this prehistoric world somewhat uncertain.

The plot was a mix between Mission Imposible/Stranger Things ( two different teams teaming up at the end)/ and some Jurassic park at the end. So it was the multiverse of no plot, so badly written that I wonder if I could do better with the same budget.It's sad, just sad and boring.

Jurassic World Dominion is a film that never takes off, filled with inconclusive subplots, ugly dialogue, uninteresting characters, an unconvincing plot, and a really bad montage of the film.

I am just going to start this review off by stating this film is getting beyond too much hate. In fact a huge amount of the critiques are unfounded, inaccurate or hyprocritical. Is it a masterpiece? No. Is it great? Maybe not. Is it bad or terrible, or as offensive as these 1/10 reviews would have you believe? No. It's good. Sure it has flaws, it definitely ain't perfect.However from a die hard super fan, who's seen all the films countless times, and the original Jurassic Park being my all time favourite, what I can say is that it was not anywhere close to what the critics or reviews would have you believe.Before I get into the rest, let me state this. The Rise of Skywalker has lines like "They fly now!" and somehow Palpatine has returned! IMDb rating? 6.5/10. Furious 7 has Dwayne Johnson rip a minigun off a drone and use it manually after driving a ambulance off a bridge to crash it. Paul Walker also drives a car through three sky scrapers. IMDB rating? 7.3/10. Black Panther, Shang Chi and numerous other MCU films have legit PS2 level CGI...did anyone see the opening sequence to Doctor Strange 2? Yep, 7.3/10, 7.4/10 & 7.3/10 respectively for those films.This film is currently sitting at 6/10 with only 10k votes, and IMDb tends to see things only drop. So my point is, does this film deserve all this hate, especially when you compare it to other films rated here? Well, no, it quite frankly is just unfair how many vague, brainless and cynical 1/10, 2/10 and 3/10 reviews are here. You don't have to like the film, but review fairly. This film, is at worst, mediocre. But I believe it's far more than that, both as a JP fan but also just as a crafted film.No Way Home, let's use that for comparison. Decent acting? Check. A long run time, fairly messy, yet fun script and story? Check. Some humor? Check. References and callbacks? Check. Return of some iconic characters, fan service and world building? Check. A decent score that probably uses a lot of old tracks from prior films? Check. Good cinematography? Check. Good CGI and practical effects?No, I'd say NWH is lacking there. And you know what? Dominion is near identical in every single category! Yet...NWH has 8.3/10 and Dominion has 6/10. You see the pattern here? This film is copping ridiculous amounts of hate. You don't have to be an award winning classic, an indie film or a Comic Book movie to be good.Jurassic World Dominion is completely faithful and respectful to the legacy of all the films, the franchise itself and Michael Critchon's work.It has beautiful cinematography, amazing CGI and awesome use of practical effects. It builds on the world and lore, and Giacchion's score is awesome as always. Grant feels like Grant. Ellie feels like Ellie. Malcolm feels like Malcolm. Owen and Claire are better than they've been, and Maisie (clone girl) is handled really well. The discourse around human cloning and the locust are straight out of Michael Critchon's work - Timeline, Micro, Westworld, Jurassic Park. Man playing god, manipulating nature and corporate greed.Dominion puts the dinosaurs back a seat and focuses on the humans - yet people complain? Everyone praises the minimal use of the dinosaurs in the original, and states it's about man's misuse of technology and character arcs, whether it be Alan or Hammond. This film does the same. Heck they even got Dogdson back, just like the novels!Does this film feature some wonky dialogue, some cheesy moments and plot conveniance? Sure. But it's not pure garbage.It's staggering how many people use the word "dumb". Yet...where is this film dumb? Like where, seriously? I LOVE the other films, but they for sure have dumb moments or moments where logic gone. But this film surprisingly doesn't! Every decision, whether it be by Owen, or Claire or Grant or whoever, is the logical choice. There's not even any suspend your belief stunts or plot armor. The characters just genuinely navigate the locations well. No dumb dino prices, no militarised hybrids, no stupid decisions leading to chaos.Heck people said they want less trained raptors and Blue, less "Fast & Furious over the top action", less Rexy saving the day, and more human content/character work.Well guess what? They gave us that. It's funny we have people saying too much dinosaurs then people saying not enough dinosaurs.What happened to being able to enjoy a summer block buster? This film is fun, enjoyable, nostalgic and true to it's roots. Half the negative reviews here don't even state any examples or evidence, they're just the typical "Hollywood bad" or "sequel bad". Don't get me wrong, I've hated plenty of films, but this film surely isn't any bit close to the current rating.My only real major gripes is despite the long run time and a huge cast, there weren't enough casualties (even for side characters) and that the prologue should've been kept to open the film.So in conclusion, please rate fairly, please don't be discouraged by reviews, and please form your own opinion. Love it? Great! Meh? Great! Hate it? Great! But don't just jump on the band wagon and don't straight up lie or pretend there's issues without evidence.My final score is, as a fan 9/10, as a film 7.5/10.

I have no idea where to start. Bad script, bad acting, bad direction, BAD special effects (original was better). It was like watching an episode of Scooby Doo where they battle dinosaurs...but not 2 hours long. Just...don't bother.

I'm a fan of all the JP movies and even fully aware the later ones are not top notch at all, I still watched them all multiple times and enjoyed them immensely because there is something magical and fun about them. They feel like an adventure, a joyride, a lost world. This one however is incredibly bad, so disappointing, such a mess and so rediculous. Cramming in too many stuff, too many attacks, too many story, too much of everything. Bad humor, no tension at all, no fun. Messy story with non-sensible characters like that woman in white? What was she suppose to be, a scary kickass female rolemodel or something? Yeah that worked..... .. Stopping a 7 ton dino with a mere lasso on horseback *rolls eyes*. The reciculous "she impregnated herself with her own DNA". *oh please!* The stupid "the system rebooted so the dead locust on the floor apparently 'reboot' too". *what now?* Even The reappearance of the original cast, which should have been a great moment, was done in a very rushed and blend way, no emotion in it at all. And then the two new characters that nobody even knows basicly end up saving the day *puke* The ending, with the "epic fight" was really just epic cringe!. Honestly, I feel like this movie was made by a bunch of 14 year olds. So going back to the first 5 movies ....I truly, truly apprecitate them even more now! In fact, compared to this one they are pretty awesome.

There was good VFX, beautiful scenery and they didn't compromise to show dinosaurs but the story line was not up to the mark as it lacks good content and talking about thrill in jurassic Park movies should be must but this movies lacks in that too.

An absolutely appalling sequel. There is no discernible plot or story line. It is nice to see the original actors but I wonder why they signed up to this. Why on earth was this made, obviously, just a money making exercise, although I suspect not much money was made. This should never have been made. It demeans the whole franchise. No More Please!!! This movie is total barrel scraping. I would not recommend anyone to watch it. The acting is wooden and the scenarios are stereotyped and repetitive. Thank goodness I did not spend money to see this at the cinema. General verdict - don't bother - this is a waste of time.

Jurassic Park is a movie that I rewatch again and again and the believability factor reigns supreme. Unfortunately with this, I switched off from the very beginning-Pros- Jeff Goldbloom, Sam Neill, somewhat nostalgic.Cons- So many continuity errors, entomological inaccuracies, scientific inaccuracies, no flow (chaotic story telling- such a tendency nowadays to overstimulate the audience rather than captivate them, poor acting)

I loved this movie! In my opinion it comes in 2nd, after the original Jurassic Park! It's a dinosaur movie for God sake, what are people expecting! I loved the return of the original cast. They were in the movie more than I expected! It's slow to start but once the storyline merged the two sets of characters it was fantastic! I am ready to go see it again!

I'll be honest here, I went into this movie with low expectations, this is because I read some of the reviews about how rubbish it is and how it's just a cash grab. But now that I have seen it I can proudly say it was a good movie and ending to a franchise.But I will say this there is so much plot holes in this film so if your going to see it just for the plot you will come out really disappointed. It's a leave your brain at the door film. Just enjoy it for what it is.

It's time to end the Jurassic franchise. This movie is just more of the same. They added giant locust in this one, so there's that. But really there was no reason to make this film. It's the same dinosaurs. The same dinosaur sounds. The same running jumping climbing swimming and hiding from dinosaurs. The same dramatic drawn out camera angles on the actors faces as they look either scared, concerned or all-knowing before scrambling to safety just in the nick of time. There was no real suspense because we knew our main characters would make it home safely. If the creators are insistent on making ANOTHER Jurassic film, please update the formula!
Dinosaur movies that are not fun, great visual effects but that do not give emotions, even the characters and the story of the film are not convincing. An insufficient film.

The original Jurassic Park is a classic. Steven Spielberg created a sense of wonder with his great direction and some very good CGI and practical effects. It was very sispenful at times but mostly audiences lived the dinosaurs. The scene when we see the T-Rex is one of the great sequences in cinema. Since that first film in 1993 I have gone from not.liking the sequels to ultimately thinking that the franchise never could recreate what made the first film so special...None of the Jurassic Park or Jurassic World films are terrible but none of them hold a candle to the original film.When Jurassic World came out I liked it but it just seemed it wasn't that memorable. Fallen Kingdom came next and I just didn't like it.This new film is being sold as an epic conclusion and they brought back three of the main characters from the first film. So obviously they are selling nostalgia, which is fine and it's been done incessantly since The Force Awakens was so successful. If done right? It works. If not it seems like desperation. Here it is pretty flat. The inclusion of Dr. Grant, Dr. Sattler, and Ian Malcolm is to me anti-climactic. Sam Neil, Laura Deen and Jeff Gold Blum are ok as these characters and but it just seems they were brought in for nostalgia and it doesn't work as much as it should. Even though the first film is beloved I don't consider these characters as beloved so it's nice to see them but it's like seeing Harrison Ford as Han in Episode 7. It's of course a fusing of the new characters from the old franchise and the new ones. Chris Pratt is fine as Owen and Bryce Dallas Howard as Claire are is ok too but nothing new happens with these characters.The dinosaurs of course are the reason to see these films and some scenes are really well done but again the sense of wonder is gone. The story is just the standard science for profit yarn mixed in with the kidnapping of the cloned girl from Fallen Kingdom. As with so many 3rd parts of a trilogy it is very overstuffed and feels unfocused fur the first half of the running time but once it gets going it does get fun. But like so many blockbusters these days you pretty much forget it by the time you leave the theater.Just average....Grade: C.

"Jurassic World Dominion" is an entertaining movie whose script is full of fanservice, especially for those like me who loved the first movie, it's quite nice to see Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum together again. In terms of logic, the script has many flaws that are justified by the science fiction theme that the film touches on. The soundtrack is good, especially the theme used in suspenseful scenes. The cinematography is powerful and provides some great visuals. The performances are good and the director does a good job. An entertaining movie but with nothing more to offer.
Two and a half hours too long. Worst ending to one of my favorite franchises. Do not waste your time or money. Zero redeeming qualities. Complete garbage.

No matter what peoples have said about these Jurassic World films, i have enjoyed these so much.These brought piece of my childhood back.I just love dinosaurs.This was great ending to trilogy.This brought back old and new.I really liked how this film started with multiple storylines about different things.And how they connected one by one so nicely.More about ethics of prehistoric species in our modern world.Some really good science fiction stuff.Good action.Great visual effects.Overall well made film.But most importantly so many different dinosaurs.And this one had so many new species.I was impressed that i'm still able to recognize so many of them.And of course there is my childhood's favorite one, Giganotosaurus!I really felt like i was child again while watching this film.And of course old faces from Jurassic Park meet new characters.This was just great.Lot of fun moments.So entertaining.

This movie's plot makes zero sense; people go back and forth to far off locations in no time and also dinosaurs inconceivably show up in logistically illogical places. They dumbed down the OG cast and gave them barely anything to do. The whole movie is just a mix of predictable jump scares mixed with Fast and the Furious like action scenes that does nothing to the plot.

Absolutely loved this movie! Great fun to see with your kids and felt so good to see the original cast again. Lots of tongue-in-cheek references for those of us who know the first ones by heart. Now It's not perfect, but then it isn't meant to be! Watch it for the fun, the action, the magnificent dinosaurs and brilliant chemistry between the cast members. Don't forget the popcorn.

Not nearly as bad as some people are making it out to be. There is too much action, and a lot of it is ridiculous. There are too many characters, and not all the performances are great. The story is somehow both simple and complex.But this might is genuinely fun. There are some cool dinosaurs, new and old. While some callbacks are a bit heavy-handed, most are pretty light and enjoyable. Big improvement from Fallen Kingdom.Here's the definitive ranking of the movies for reference:
Jurassic Park
Jurassic World
Dominion
JP3
Lost World
Fallen Kingdom.
What an insult to Michael Crichton's original work. It's sad that this is how the franchise is put out to pasture, but thankfully it's over.It. Is. Done.

I just don't get it! I've just seen it and was actually reluctant to go after reading quite a bit of negativity about it BUT it's actually not bad! It's a solid 7.5/10, I was entertained, the set prices were great and the old and the new cast blended well. Go see it expecting to be entertained and you'll have fun!

Jurassic World Dominion scrapes away the very last traces of legacy remaining from the original Jurassic Park film (which still stands as a great movie). From the opening few minutes the scene is set for a dumb, unimaginative, tension-free, forgettable and utterly wasteful film.The dinosaurs are either upstaged by insects or relegated to jump-scare caricatures constantly popping out of every dark corner when the movie needs them to.There is no attempt to build up tension, as exemplified in the very opening sequence when the sea monster from the previous film pops up again to zero effect. That opening lasts less than a minute but probably amounted to more than many indie films entire budget.Chris Pratt completes his journey from promising new screen presence to bland franchise prop and together with Bryce Dallas Howard, achieves some sort of record as least amount of on-screen chemistry between a couple.The old crew return but only to prove that decent actors capable of creating interesting on-screen relationships can be totally undermined by a terrible script and poor direction. Meanwhile, new additions to the cast such as Dewanda Wise, Mamoudie Athie and Campbell Scott are devoid of screen charisma, acting ability or anything interesting to contribute. Scott in particular is probably one of the most ineffectual and dull on-screen 'villians' I've ever seen.Every single minute contained something stupid, irritating or unintentionally funny.As just one example, the film begins with the cliche of an exposition News item - designed to get the viewer up to speed - in which the presenter informs the populace that dinosaurs are now a global phenonmenon and have been for quite some time.Stop for a moment and consider if a single dinosaur had really been resurrected in our world, does anybody think that in a 24 hour news culture combined with ubiquitous social media and internet access - that anybody capable of watching the news would be unaware of that fact?On top of this, we are informed that the global death toll attributed to dinosaurs is 37. A minute, you ask? No, 37 in a year. Presumably that's not including the entire ship that just got destroyed by our aforementioned jaws stand-in?In the past fifteen years, 74 people have been killed by cows - in the UK alone. Cows.Allosaurs, pterodactyls and T. Rex are roaming our natural habitat and less people are killed than by accidents with butter knives.Shame on you, Mr Spielberg, for endorsing this trash.

We get a final gathering of all the familiar faces in this maybe final episode. It's a lightweight, feelgood movie that focuses on the core elements of what made Jurassic Park so great. Without annoying child characters.And the new reality, exploring the consequences of dinosaurs coexisting with humanity, offers something we haven't seen yet. It's not as thrilling and doesn't have these in-awe moments. But that's OK. It's still a great adventure in the Jurassic Park universe and a fine end for its legacy.The CGI was great most of the time.With its fine balance between nostalgia and innovation it's a recommend-watch for fans of the series.

It's amazing to see the original cast of Jurassic Park and Jurassic World! It's like a reunion adventure movie! I was expecting a more in depth connection of those characters but seems it gave us a small treat or preview only, given the run time, they could combine more further. Nevertheless, it was a great movie to see especially to those Dino fans like me!

Wasted 2.5 hrs. No story line. Forced characters. Doesn't make sense. Revisiting old scenes were awful. CGI is too game like. I remember watching the 1st Jurassic Park as a kid and thought the T. Rex was going to jump out of the screen. Overall one of the worse movie. Don't waste your time and money. It felt like a money grab by these movie makers exploiting a good classic movie. How much more can they milk this.

The first half was slow which made me slightly bored but the second half, which was action packed made up for it. They bring back the og trio and they along with the MCs do all they can to stop the villian from gaining total control over the food economy of the world.

Despite having the most potential and the original trilogy cast finally returning, Jurassic World: Dominion manages to squander all of that potential in an overly long, pointless mess with no stakes, cheap nostalgia and a level of stupid that's a new low even for this trilogy.It's constantly swapping ideas and genres in all the worst ways, barely feeling like an actual Jurassic movie. The dinosaurs are barely in it and have little to no effect on the narrative, instead simply used for a few entertaining set pieces and then quickly forgotten.Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are somehow given less depth the third time round, making their characters even more forgettable and bland. However, the original cast are obviously great and elevate the extremely weak material given to them.The music by Michael Giacchino is a huge letdown. It does nothing new and is simply content in repeating all the familiar tunes from previous ones but they're not even integrated well, almost always feeling random and out of place.However, the film looks nice overall with visuals that are a league above the average blockbuster. There is a lot of satisfying practicality when it comes to the dinosaurs which is really nice to see, even if some look cheap.

Ok plot wise this movie is bad and has a bit of a slow start however the action scenes are fun if not a bit Predicable, but being the 6th movie they are out of ideas so you can enjoy the movie if you focus on the Dinos which do not disappoint. In the end it could be worse.

Result of Poor writing . Only thing that satisfied me was action sequence before the interval , it really gave a seat edge experience , other than that whole movie was underwhelming . Script was too weak and lame . Except few places , film majorly missed the engaging factor . First half was slow and second half was predictable and boring . 2hrs 30mins was too long , literally tested my patience . Cast done their job . Technically visuals were good . Editing was inferior . Overall , unexpectedly a disastrous end to Jurassic saga . Watch at your own risk .

Watched it last night at Cineworld on a 4DX 3D screen.(If anyone has watch it prefer 4D/3D at least)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie)A true Jurassic Park and Jurassic World series fan BUT this time they have messed with the plot, tone, aura for what Jurassic movies are known for.Back in time, these movies were used to be Dinosaur centric, revolving around their habitat, that real feeling of
human's trapped with no way out. Legend 'Steven Spielberg' has executed it brilliantly and so did the characters.What I personally feel, Colin Trevorrow is losing the indigenous taste from the previous Jurassic Park/World movies (except Fallen Kingdom which was a disaster too).If something has to be appreciated about this movie then it has to be the reunion of the original trio (Alan Grant, Ellie Sattler, Ian Malcom).Again, no need to forcefully create those nostalgic moments from the previous parts unless they actually fit in there.It fails at switching between the scenes and connecting the dots.In a nutshell, we don't want to see any unnecessary new technology additions. Stick to the original flavour. Don't spoil the Franchise with any unrealistic experiments. Dinosaurs are scary even without any genome modification, that would make them sound more like a robot and less like a dinosaur.*FROM A DIE-HARD JURASSIC MOVIE SERIES FAN*

Tired, bloated and overlong supposedly final film in the Jurassic series (Yea right) finds the legacy characters from Jurassic Park crossing paths with the Jurassic World characters in a film that makes its first major mistake by not only not paring them up sooner (They only meet in the last twenty minutes of the film) but have them run separate and equally dumb storylines that really has nothing to do with dinosaurs or what this film was advertised to do. (Planet of the dinosaurs anyone?) . Of the pair of storylines running in this movie, the mutant locus one, (while it has nothing to do with dinosaurs at all) is the better of the two and the reason why because despite it being still dumb and having nothing to with dinosaurs, it's actually more interesting and better acted. The Jurassic Park characters which includes a rejuvenated and game Sam Neill (who redeems his terrible performance from Jurassic Park 3 ) Laura Dern (Who was barley in Jurassic Park 3, thank god) and a top of his game Jeff Goldblum ( who was in this franchise's only fairly good and solid sequel "The Lost World" and mercifully only had few minutes of screen times in its second worst sequel "Fallen Kingdom") all try their best with the hooky yet brainless material they are working with and for the most part they succeed. Both Sam Neill and Laura Dern pick up seamlessly their natural chemistry from the original Jurassic Park and it's sweet and compelling while Jeff Goldblum naturally picks up Ian Malcolm's sense of self righteous bitting wit and disarming charm. While the script has some of the worst dialogue all three actors have had to work with, only Goldblum manages to turn the tables on the terrible screenplay he was had to work with some quick witted improvisation that gotten the biggest laughs in the entire movie which has him almost breaking what they call the 4th wall and making fun of most of things that are happening in this film, which is a god sent because Jeff is really telling the audience that he knows this movies sinks and he understands what the audience is going through. A brilliant master stroke that only a great actor like Goldblum can pull off undetected from the director and producers of a film they are working on that they think stinks.The second of the storylines while more action oriented, is not only more dimwitted but lacks focus and is barely even acted at all. It's a continuation of the plot threads that was left over from the last movie and it's tries to recon certain revelations but still ends up worthless and uninspired. Chris Pratt phones in his performance and you can sense he knows this film is not very good. Bryce Dallas Howard tried her best but her character still is as underdeveloped as ever and the only actor who comes out of this storyline with her head high is Dewanda Wise, manages to not only steal the spotlight from Pratt and Howard but her character manages to be a hell of a lot more interesting . Unfortunately, not even her great acting talent can overcome the terrible script that does no one any favors and rips off several action sequences from "The Borne Ultimatum" which involves a roof top and motorcycle chase in a foreign city. In this film, those rip off sequences added raptors and James Bond bad guys to chase our heroes in the city of "Malta" and even with those added elements, they lacked the kinetic energy and intensity that "Borne" movie had in spades.In conclusion, the movie while better than the brain dead "Fallen Kingdom", it's still a bloated mess. And despite the game efforts by the returning Jurassic Park cast (Especially a great self aware performance by Jeff Goldblum) and a scene stealing, star making turn by Dewanda Wise, it's probably time to end this franchise before they turn out a movie that is "Jurassic Park 3" bad.
New and interesting stories, intertwining plots, throwbacks to the past movies and books, action, comedy, new dinosaurs to live action and the classics dinos.

Jurassic Park is a franchise that has been milked to death, that can't be denied. Universal is claiming that Jurassic World: Dominion will be the last of the franchise, and that's probably for the best. They took the extra measure, as most franchises have done this day, of bringing back the original cast - Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum - for this last movie. Well, they credit at least for treating them well, unlike a certain other sci-fi franchise. This aside, Dominion is a thoroughly mediocre blockbuster that contains virtually nothing you've never seen before. Oddly enough, it really wasn't what I expected it to be, for better or for worse.Dominion is essentially two movies in one, with a common link. There's the OG cast going undercover at the BioSyn lab, and there's Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard trying to save Maisie from the corporation. The story with the originals isn't too special, but it was nice to see them, and they still acted like themselves. The plot with the new characters was something completely different. For a while, the movie essentially becomes Taken with dinosaurs. On one hand, it is a fun action scene. On the other hand, this is so far removed from the previous films that it's glaring. When they come together at the end and escape from dinos the old-fashioned way, it's entertaining.One thing this movie does really wrong is that it fails to deliver on the premise set up by Fallen Kingdom's ending. The ending of Fallen Kingdom has it that dinosaurs roam the entire world, not just Isla Nublar. Aside from the beginning and end of Dominion, you'd never know. The writing is bad. The characters don't feel like people, they feel more like tools to get the story going. On the other hand, there are some good things. The visual effects are noticeably improved from the first film, and Michael Giacchino delivered another solid score. Wu got a nice redemption arc. Dominion does have some interesting attributes, but it doesn't necessarily make it a good film. If this really is the end for this franchise, then it's been quite a run. Nothing comes close to the original in the end.

My review is 2,582 so I feel I can say anything I want because who on earth is going to see this one!!This was the most exhausting movie I've watched in recent memory.So many chases - all with animals, of course. Dinos. The first hour had so many non-stop chases, that it was actually exhausting to watch. I'd have to stop and go do something. A little bit of this, a little bit of that. Then back to the chase. If it had a motorcycle in it, it was Chris Pratt.There was one scene that was very much like the bar scene in Star Wars. So all the big movies now are "borrowing" from Star Wars. If Tom Cruise in Top Gun 2 could do it, then so could they. It'll be interesting to see how many more movies copy Star Wars.That said, one can only hope that if enough of us point out that we actually see their plagiarisms and call them on it, maybe we can get some original movies out of Hollywood. What a concept!!

I WISH they would have kept the show focused on Chris Pratt instead of doing equal time to all these other characters. You can definitely tell Hollywood to cramming all these female actors down our throats. FINE! But THIS movie started Chris Pratt I'm expecting to see mostly Chris Pratt! Ugh! Show up an hr into the movie and you'll be fine. It was more of a mini series crammed into 2.5hrs, and it didn't work. Should have kept the focus on the main character and his relationship with Blue and her baby. If you have nothing else to watch and it's really hot where you live right now AND you need a good nap, go see it. ü§∑

This is just bad enough to make me write this review.So bad that made me doubt if the first ever Jurassic Park was even overrated. You had all the topics, actors and nostalgia and you still screw this up this bad. I am sorry but Colin Trevorrow really failed not just this movie but the entire franchise. Money back requested.

I don't know why everybody hates it, I will agree the movie isn't as much about dinosaurs as it should be and it's more about that girl, but I still enjoyed it. It's nothing special but still a good entertaining movie.

I don't understand this, don't they watch their own movie before release? The script is bad, director was worst, editing tried to save some of it, but no... I will not watch this ever again, I don't recommend it! Don't waste your time or money, go watch the first jurassic park again. What a waste.. Fx are great, but with that kind of money, it has to be... 2 nice moments can't save the film. Why would you do this?

I'd give it an 8.5
Its got flaws of course, but the film is amazing. Beautiful landscapes and sceneries, very good use of CGI and animatronics.Original even, even if many didn't appreciate the new plot and ideas, I did very much. It's more in line with what Michael Crichton wrote in the first few pages of his novel, Jurassic Park.

I love this movie, its a great ending to the series (or at least this storyline). Lost of cameos and lore that tie even more things together. Got to see alot of new things to enjoy. I especially enjoyed how the very end was because I wasn't sure how they would go about it.I feel the biggest reason the movie(s) are disliked is young people today think they are all movie critics and follow the Oscars. Thus they think the only good movie is something that is Oscar worthy. Movies exist to entertain us, not just win awards.JP/JW were never super deep movies with deep stories, deep lines and deep everything. They were your normal summer fun films. The kind you just shut off your brain for and enjoy. If you liked all the movies so far, you will also enjoy this one. That simple.Again, ignore the very bad reviews since they obviously are not able to just enjoy a movie and have fun. And to note, actually read the popular negative reviews, they all mention the hated the movies are predictable, ignore issues with plotholes...etc. Then they say the only good things about the movies are "they are fun". See? The movies are about fun and they don't like they are fun, to them fun is not enough. Hence the reviews are so bad, people lost the ability to have fun.

I heard mixed opinions before going, but having seen the franchise from the beginning in 1993...Was only right to go see!Not sure about the reviews of 1s & 2s but it held my attention with plenty of action and good set pieces.. Dinosaurs looked great and some great jumpy bits!** No spoilers - But... Ending could of been better, but overall, decent watch!

I can honestly say in good faith that Jurassic World: Dominion is the worst film in the entire series. And people thought Jurassic Park III was horrible. Jeez, this one here takes the cake. The plot has nothing to do with dinosaurs.You don't miss anything by not watching it. Personally, Jurassic Park is the best film, followed by Lost World, Jurassic Park III, Jurassic World, Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, and Dominion. Yes, the films got worse with every new entry. I was least entertained by the previous two entries.I can't help but feel this inconsistent, out-of-place trilogy deserves a quick comparison to the Star Wars sequel trilogy. Jurassic World hits the same beats as The Force Awakens. Rehash anyone? While the setup is there and you can build off it, originality is nonexistent.Then came The Last Jedi, which derailed the Star Wars saga. Fallen Kingdom was just boring. I can't consider it anything better than average. Its plot was nonsensical, and viewers begin to care less about our Jurassic World characters by the end of Act 3. That's never a good thing.Now, Dominion is on par with Rise of Skywalker for being so fast paced, poorly edited, introducing new things (species) every couple of minutes, bringing back dead or old characters for nostalgia bait, abusing special effects and letting action scenes carry the film, etc.Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) lost his charisma in this one. The only times I felt genuinely entertained was seeing Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) make subtle quips. If you want to see Pratt's potential, watch the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers films.You can skip Fallen Kingdom and Dominion and not miss anything. The story does not make a positive impact on prior films nor does it add substance to the overarching narrative, which is the study of dinosaurs. There's nothing of value here. Give it a few years for the die-hard fans to wake up. The Jurassic World trilogy offers very little re-watchability.

Jurrassic Park was a Pop Culture masterpiece. Sequels will not recapture that initial magic. However I found Jurassic World Dominion fun and satisfying for the most part. It was great to see the union and reunion of past and present characters. There were nice character arcs and cool dinosaurs and action scenes. That's all I needed. I'm not sure why the critics raged it so poorly. Most average viewers enjoyed it. Just enjoy it for what it is.

Do not reminisce over the old jurassic park movies. Watch it with a fresh perspective and it will be very entertaining. Old and new characters and scenes are combined in this movie to make the franchise go out with a bang!Ignore the other reviews. It was a good movie.

This was terrible in every way. Bad acting, terrible script, bad CGI and stupid decisions (on and off the screen) cannot rely on nostalgia for a good film.1. Ellie is not as stupid as the film makes her out to be, as one of the characters signposts the fact that he is a double agent and she apparently doesn't pick up on it.2. Everyone seems to be phoning in their parts. They know the film will make money, so in their minds why bother I guess? The absolute worst culprit Campbell Scott who plays Dogson- I have no words. He's terrible and I can't tell if it's due to the script or he wasn't right for this part. It might be both. The original cast are awful- they don't seem enthusiastic to be there and I don't blame them.3. The plot makes no sense. After lengthy exposition opening the film we dive headfirst into one bad and nonsensical decision after another. For example, despite knowing that everyone is looking for her Maisie goes into town, despite being told not to, sees a dinosaur at a construction site then comes back. What was the point of this?! And this is just in the first 10 minutes- there are plenty more. Also, Owen is catching Parasaurolophus with a lasso on a horse, despite the fact that if the dinosaur spooks for any reason it will drag both him and the horse along for the ride? He was dragged from the horse already- surely he's learned his lesson?4. The callbacks to the original film take you out of the story. Instead of being subtle they practically scream "notice me!"5. The CGI is bad and doesn't blend well with the puppets they clearly used in some scenes. I applaud the fact that they are going back to puppetry, but it needs to be seamless with the CGI.6. The script. Wow. Some of the lines are so cringeworthy I can't believe they made it into a Hollywood blockbuster. Just... wow.Do yourself a favour and watch the original Jurassic Park- pretend this one and Fallen Kingdom don't exist.

I have been a fan of this series since the first trailer for the original jurassic park came out. So every sequel I have expected certain things or the story to explain more in the past park and characters. This film delivered on some of them but opened more questions. As an adult I wished the film was longer and certain things could be explained more but it felt like the studio made the director cut alot out for timing purposes to get more showing in the theatre. However this is still a good movie and I am lucky to have been a child when the first one game out and now being a father watched this with my two sons. They loved this movie saying it was the best. They loved the Dino action, they loved all the character returning and they wanted more and hoping for more jurassic films. This is a Dino movie and children love them. Ignore what the critics are saying and if you've got kids, go and see this movie. It's enjoyable and worth a watch.

Another prime example of Hollywood recycling the same script over again and marketing it as a "sequel".Impossible to post "spoilers", everyone knows this story...we saw it twice before.Same misguided, greedy scientist... same safe, remote sanctuary... same black market... same heros in car, in sanctuary, with T-Rex scratching the paint... Toss in a female, lesbian (likes redheads too), black with a few rainbow patches and you got yourself a "new movie"?Even the little bit of new scenarios added were poorly written with inconsistent timelines: "your mother had a genetic disorder, she found out "AFTER" you were born...Next lines: "do I have this disorder"? No, your mom altered this out of your genes so you would not suffer the same fate." Wait what?!?! You just said her mom didn't know about her genetic disorder until "AFTER" she was born! Guess mom invented a time machine as well. How does blatant mistakes like this make it past editing?!?I tell me friends to "skip this one", you already saw it...

The people who wrote and directed this should NEVER BE ABLE TO write and/or direct another movie again. Colin Trevaro and his fellow writing goons are an embarrassment to hollywood and an embarrassment to cinema. I normally wouldn't review a movie on here but I signed only so could leave this review (it's that BAD. I felt like I had to. I felt that passionate). This movie was a worthless embarrassing piece of garbage. The people who made this and the "Jurassic World Series" destroyed a legacy, and that a beautiful one made by Steven Spielberg and his team. This movie and the entire Jurassic World series need to be erased from the Jurassic canon. And Colin Trevaro and the writers he works with need to be banned from making movies. What a joke. What an absolute joke.

Incredible movie. It has emotion, nostalgia, humour, and is just a great film overall! The addition of a new cast of dinosaurs combined with a much different storyline keeps things fresh, but the inclusion of original cast members, throwback scenes, and nostalgic item inclusions gives that true Jurassic Park feeling.

I've scrolled through so many negative reviews, and they are such BS. People are complaining about things that don't even make sense. Things that every Jurrassic Park movie has always done.Like having coincidences like the characters being in the right place at the right time. I remember being in the theater for Jurrassic park 2 with someone who laughed about that happening.Or one person complained about there being too many new dinosaurs and dinosaur attacks....well if you don't want to see new dinosaurs and more dinosaur attacks, why are you watching another Jurrassic park movie?Then there's the complaint that certain little details aren't realistic. Are you freaking kidding me...it's a sci fi/fantasy film about dinosaurs existing alongside humans....including one GMO dinosaur....and you are going to focus in on little details that aren't realistic? If you want to watch a realistic movie, you have chosen the wrong genre entirely.And then there's the complaint that the story isn't good. Um, what movie were you watching? Because there's very little wrong with the story. It builds upon all of the previous movies just like a good story should. It deals with modern issues and is more relevant to our real world than any of the others have been. It has so many good plot points and story elements. It has a lot of throwbacks to the first one, as well as some very new additions. And it is obvious to me that the people complaining about this story don't know anything about writing and story telling. And it's really just that they don't like the movie.But there's really little wrong with the film making either. Again, nothing that hasn't been wrong with some of the other films. They put a lot of work into making this movie. It looks fantastic. And I think the main reason people are complaining so much is not because of things that are wrong with the film. But because they already stopped being fans of the franchise and at this point it can't do anything right.Because there have been Jurrassic Park films before this that were not very good. And it has been a long time, and it does seem that these people leaving negative reviews are just disgrunted ex fans who are sick of it. And so if you are watching a movie that is over 2 hours long and you are really just sick of the franchise and watching it because you are bored and have nothing else to do (and probably have a bad attitude because of that), that would explain the negative reviews.But it also seems to me that with all the throwbacks to the first film, that anyone who loved the first one should also love this one. So maybe a lot of these people just don't like the genre or this type of movie.However if you are looking for a movie about dinosaurs living alongside humans, and are looking to have fun and don't want something that is serious and based in reality, but is just good cinematic entertainment, and you enjoyed the first film, there's a good chance you will like this one. Don't expect it to fix a bad attitude or anything. If you are the type of person who needs to complain about every little thing, well maybe instead of sitting around judging other peoples work you should get off your ass and try making a movie yourself so you can see how much work it actually is and gain a better appreciation of the art of film and how much actually goes into them. Because as a videographer myself, I tend to appreciate film a lot more because I have an understanding of these things that most people don't. And I find it ridiculous when I hear people complaining like this, in ways that make no sense and show that they don't know jack about film and are probably just a negative and pathetic excuse for a human being who entertains themselves by watching movies they aren't really into and then complaining about them.In my honest opinion, this film is the second best in the series next to the first one. There was so much about it that I loved. So much that they did right that I thought was absolute pure gold. So many amazing movie moments that made me want to just applaud them. It's a travesty that all of these internet trolls who probably couldn't even properly frame a shot aren't being fair to it. But I guess thats just how people are these days.

That scene with Chris Pratt with his hand out and Blue with its baby. That's exactly what it looked like to me. Good blue, roll over... I'm being generous giving this movie three stars out of 10. What was that madness? What a ridiculous way to end the Jurassic Park legacy. Coexisting with a planet of dinosaurs?? I can't imagine anyone being in a theater subjected to that mess. Cocaine is alive and well amongst the writers.As I watched it all I could do was try to relate to it as a Hollywood cartoon or animated fantasy just to give myself a reason to keep watching it. The level of melodrama was astounding. At least in the original Jurassic Park there was an air of possibility. Michael Crichton's story. True wonderment.
A not very funny and too long film, the script does not shine and the characters neither. A big wasted opportunity, a mediocre short film. Jurrrasic World disappointment.

Essentially "Jurassic World Dominion" is just a rather weak storyline based on nostalgia and following the same formula throughout the course of the entire movie.But I am getting ahead of myself here. Sure, I was thrilled to sit down and watch the 2022 movie "Jurassic World Dominion", as a conclusion to the movies. And I will say that the movie definitely was off with a bang.The storyline in "Jurassic World Dominion", as written by Emily Carmichael, Colin Trevorrow and Derek Connolly was a bit weak. And by that I mean it wasn't a rather wholesome or particularly profound and deep storyline here. It was essentially just taking the protagonists of the movie, which now included members of the original "Jurassic Park" trilogy, members of the "Jurassic World" trilogy and some new ones, and having them move from A to B while intercepted by a dangerous dinosaur, then move from B to C while intercepted by a dangerous dinosaur, and moving from C to D while intercepted by, and you guessed it, a dangerous dinosaur but also by oversized mutated locusts this time.The writers cater a lot to viewers of the original trilogy with lots of props and events that you can recognize if you have watched and enjoyed the first trilogy. And sure, it does work, but it just becomes a little bit tacky as the movie progresses. But at the same time it was also somewhat enjoyable to watch things again on the screen that was seen or done in other movies in the franchise, sort of the circling being completed in a way.Visually then "Jurassic World Dominion" was phenomenal. The special effects and CGI team really are working magic to brink the dinosaurs and the world to life. I enjoyed this CGI extravagance, and it is actually a major part of the movie. If a movie like "Jurassic World Dominion" had dubious CGI, it just wouldn't work. But luckily the CGI here is amazing to look at; pure eye-candy.The movie does have a good cast ensemble. It is a cast ensemble that unites the members of the original trilogy with those of the new trilogy; so you have Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum teaming up with Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard and Isabella Sermon. And the movie also have a wonderful appearance by BD Wong, and also by DeWanda Wise. I am not sure about whether or not I really liked Campbell Scott's part in the movie, sure I liked his performance, but the character was just too much something resembling Steve Jobs."Jurassic World Dominion" is a movie that is worth watching if you have enjoyed the five previous movies, of course it is. And it is entertaining enough for what it turns out to be. Sure, I wasn't expecting director Colin Trevorrow to re-invent the wheel here with this 2022 action adventure. If for nothing else, then watch "Jurassic World Dominion" for the special effects and CGI.The whole concept of humans and the wildlife of today's world coexisting with dinosaurs was just a bit far fetched for my liking. But hey, it looked good - and sappy - on the screen.My rating of "Jurassic World Dominion" lands on a solid six out of ten stars. It is definitely well worth the time.

The only momment satisfied me was that seeing Dr. Grant and Dr. Ellie together again, everything else just was unbearable: the lazy scripting, poorly written conversation, over-the-place film flow, lame music, super-hero character, cliche action, random & lack of coherent cut scences... like you put all materials of JP + JW, mix them all together and hope new movie finds a way?! No, just same thing but different labelling number! What is the good VFX for if the story does not tell the story????Could not belive they can do this to their fans. Contradicting to the promise of the director, this final chapter delivers nothing but disappointment and anger! I respect the crew, cast and all the efforts they put into making this but to me, the movie is a flop.Would not recommend to watch in theater. Big no no!

Fun movie dinos eating people little story in there action sequence were great but story felt plausible and rushed. Great to see the old school introduce to new school and a few surprises thrown in not what I thought it was gonna be but not as bad as lost world just get some popcorn shut off ur mind and have fun.

This movie is an outrage to the original work.I mean, everything that is beautiful and astonishing in the Jurassic Park concept is completely absent in this film.They actually shot a movie that looks like it came out of the monsterverse (but of poor quality), taking out the dinosaurs and adding random stuff. If already in the first two of the World saga, the creatures have completely stopped behaving like animals but have been humanized to excess (do you remember the smile of the indoraptor? I remember it while I sleep), here they are a simple outline to totally unrelated events. The cast is simply out of control. The only positive aspect that comes to mind about this so-called movie is that Crichton is no longer with us and he would not be able to witness this abomination. Trevorrow had the incredible merit of making me reevaluate Star Wars episode IX.
Though you thought the plot will revolve about the coexistence of Humans and Dinosaurs, they failed to do that.Still love the CGI of the Dinosaurs, so worth the watch.

Sorry Hollywood, there must have been some sort of misunderstanding here.You had the budget, you had the return of the legacy cast, you had the source material, two amazing novels and the original movies to draw inspiration from, yet you come up with this? I've played Jurassic Park video games that have a more competent, creative and entertaining story. Everyone involved with the writing of this story should be embarrassed with themselves. Pretty much every scene that occurred I was waiting for Vin Diesel to show up and say something about family.I think I speak for everyone when I say we don't want laser pen controlled Raptors chasing Chris Pratt around Malta on a motorbike. If there's anyone out there who disagrees, I hope you are happy.At this point I think this franchise needs to call it quits and that's coming from someone who has a special place in their heart for Jurassic Park and dinosaurs in general.Seriously, how did the dinosaurs look better in 1993 than they do now hahahaha.

I rated Jurassic World Dominion with a seven because I like that kind of movies, adventures with prehistoric animals but in all fairness the story wasn't the greatest. It was much too exaggerated, much too simple at times, and the acting was sometimes not that great either. I've never been a big fan of Chris Pratt, think he's just a mediocre actor and that didn't change with this movie. And Laura Dern isn't an actress I appreciate a lot either so those two combined isn't a success formula for me. The only reason I score it this high, maybe too high, is because of the CGI's which were very good, and that's what made it entertaining. Maybe it's time to call it a day with the Jurassic franchise. At one point enough is enough.

The film is of course not innovative and is also a film where two worlds come together. And to finish it off well, it's not going well. The cast of the first three films and the last two. And then a story has to be made of it. And that's where it goes wrong. Just like the montages. The story is also not accurate in time. And the dolomites is a huge area. And yet the beasts can get inside in a short time. In short, the film has to rely on the dinosaurs, locations, humor, scary moments and good film images. The film survives that. Especially the scene with the water is beautifully filmed. But the bad guy isn't a bad guy and it won't work out. But it's like transformers. Dinosaurs save the movie. So it remains sufficient.

I just can't believe how bad this movie is. One of the lamest, most pathetic, banal and uninteresting movies I've ever seen. It couldn't be farther from the original Jurassic Park, in any possible way. The acting is quite bad, everything is sooo predictable, dinosaurs have almost no relevance to the plot, but the worst thing is the amount of cheesy cheap good feelings the movie is packed with, those murdering monsters being treated like pets... What an incredible waste of money and time (both theirs and mine).
You know what's going to happen almost from the off. But don't let this detract from the fact that this film is hugely enjoyable. And brings the gang together!

Banging around to all points on the globe, this synthetic, committee-written, mess recalls too many old characters and introduces too many new characters who take turns being nipped at by expertly created dinos at well-timed intervals. As usual, a rich white man is the source of all evil and characters of various ethnicities and sexual orientations save the day. If it was written by a computer, kudos to the programmer. If it was written by humans, I need to check your papers... and your pulse.

The only thing i really liked about the movie was the ending which had some cool scenes. The movie felt empty, generic and unsurprising. As seen in teasers the cast of the Jurassic Park movies were introduces without a wow element so to speak, the movie felt rushed even when it has quite a runtime and nothing really made sense as someone else has also reviewed.Scenes did not make sense, the hand thing from Owen was weird and overused as if that does anything with a predator dinosaur... The threat from them was also non existent. I wanted to love this movie but simply could not. The 'getting the gang back together' trope could have worked allot better had they taken more time in making the plot more clear.I would wait to see it until it shows on a streaming service so you don't waste your money on a film ticket.

7/10 - maybe I'm just a sucker for a legacy cast return a la Scream and Spider-Man: No Way Home, but if you can get past the rambling and frankly unnecessary first hour, some bad acting from the majority of the cast (Dern, Wise, Athie, and Howard are the major exceptions), and some not good and maybe even bad cinematography, you will find a lot to enjoy in this sixth installment and end of a Jurassic era even with its flaws.

This movie is an insult to its viewers. Last time I felt like this was after watching transformers 2. It is just a giant mess. The story is convoluted and has no meaning. The supposedly scary encounters with the carnivores do not produce any atmospheric impact. Woke messaging of course included as well. This movie shall be remembered as part of the prime degeneracy of hollywood.

I love the Jurassic Parc franchise, but there has never been much of a plot, except people screaming and running away from those CGI animals.The last installment is the same formula. They tried to put some disturbing plot into play, but it hadn't much of a use. For me it's all about the suspense/action parts, and some of the scenes were all bit the same thing I have seen before. I think the best action sequence was the scene in Malta. Well edited and amazing camera work. I loved DeWanda Wise, she gave a lot of flair to her performance. Absolutely loved to see the original 3 have a big part in the movie (Laura Dern cracks me up!). And Bryce Dallas Howard always puts on a great, scary performance. Plus points for the cast for sure.I absolutely enjoyed myself for 2h30, but it won't be my favourite one of the full installment. Still more than recommend to watch this at the cinema!

Whoever made the brilliant decision to give the keys to the Jurassic franchise to Colin Trevorrow and to let him write all three of these atrocities should be fired.It's actually shocking how they are doing exactly what the original film was against. Also bringing back the original cast just so the masses will go "I remember that" and clap like the morons they are is exactly what is wrong with Hollywood films today.These producers "Were So Preoccupied With Whether Or Not They Could, They Didn't Stop To Think If They Should."
This movie was a little disappointing on that the plot was really bad. The visual effects, sound and score are great but they barely compensate for the dumb story. The previous one was better imo.

Yes, movie started off slow, but overall a great ending to the Jurassic Park/World era.....I've watched this series since the beginning (when in high school), & is near & dear to my heart (especially the music). I do not agree with the low reviews by critics/movie watchers whatsoever! Our audience clapped at the end of the movie & we all left very pleased!

Never underestimate Hollywood's ability to take something phenomenal and cherished and suck the life out of it for money. The dinosaurs felt more like window dressing than the focus. Disjointed, impossible to keep up with or care about the myriad of story lines. Actually walked out with 30 minutes left because the ending is just a conclusion to a ridiculous dumpster fire.

Do not trust the bad reviews. Dominion is back to it's roots in a fun, cheesy romp with scary dinos.People are honestly overanalyzing this, it's not meant to be a masterpiece, it never was. Most people are rating it as overthinking adults and forgetting they watched it as kids with open imagination.It's incredibly cheesy and often over acted, but like most of the greats it's what also makes it fun..the CGI is great the "dinos per minute" was perfect for the kids. My kids never got bored watching adults talk on screen about a story they likely didn't really care about and over explaining the science. The pacing was great to keep them entertained from scene to scene.I absolutely loved the nostalgia and think it did a great job honouring the original whilst bringing the story to a close.But advised not to watch with boring adult head on. Just go in, have fun and enjoy the dinosaurs and cheese.

At 2 hours and 26 minutes, this marks the longest movie in the Jurassic series. May he Rest In Peace, but it's probably good that Michael Crichton wasn't alive to see this abomination of a film. The only reason I'm even giving an extra star is because the dinosaurs looked good and some of the cinematography was on point, but my god this was unbearable to watch.My biggest problem with this film is how predictable the story was and how shallow of a character its antagonist was. Nothing against Campbell Scott, I'm sure he's a swell guy, but watching him play this character was like watching a lifeless Dave Wallace from The Office. He had no depth, no angle, and every choice he made could be seen from 100 miles away.Another reason I couldn't stand this movie was how many times Chris Pratt got everyone out of trouble by putting his hand up to the dinosaurs. I can't tell you how badly I wanted him to try it just to have one of them take a couple fingers off. It might've added some excitement to the movie.I really wish I could keep going and tell you about how bad the whole thing was; but since I fell asleep for fifteen minutes of the movie, I guess it wouldn't be very honest of me to say I saw the entire thing. This is supposed to be the last movie of the series, so I was expecting some crazy things to be happening. I wanted to see dinosaurs fighting in the city, knocking into buildings, and stepping on cars. Instead, we were served a recycled plot with generic action and storytelling.Give me a job, Universal, and I'll write a better script with my eyes closed. Or go outside your doors and find the nearest crackhead because I'd guarantee you 100% they could write a better movie, too.

The reviews have not been kind to this movie. It is better than expected and overly long and repetitive. The plot is good guys get in bad situation with dinosaurs, then bad guys get in same situation and get their just rewards. Repeat. Repeat. Repeat.This movie is simply too long. It throws in characters from the first three Jurrassic Park films (from the 1990's), puts them in dangerous situations which they luckily, sometimes cleverly, escape. Luck never runs out for our heroes but the bad guys eventually shoot craps.It would be much better if twenty to thirty minutes were cut. Perhaps if one of the protagonists actually didn't escape every time?

I'm not sure what they were trying to achieve with this movie, but I'm guessing this wasn't it.Poor writing, direction, acting, cinematography....Predictable, phoned in corny/cringe lines and trying to revisit the original and failing on all accounts.

Watched it twice so far, including in 3D: IMAX (bring a pair of ear plugs)...!¬± FANTASTIC ¬±Missed 3d "dbox" version though - apparently, elvis was more important to certain decision makers in the st. Petersburg, florida FILM businass!
Yes, the bad guys are predictable. So are the good guys. Some characters are redeemed. This brings back memories and old faces, it saves the day, and just makes for a fun watch.

I have nothing to say
I truly miss the jurassic PARK movies and idc what anyone says, they were the best.Now everything has to be involved with some sort of tech.. and the writing keeps getting worse
& CGI wont fix a bad movie.

I almost skipped this movie after going through the comments in IMDB section.But when I watched it was completely entertaining. Afterall fun and entertainment is the reason to go to movies.Pros
The introduction of few new species of dinosaurRaptor chase in Europe ( Spain/Portugal??)Uniting all the charactersCons
Most of the reviews here talk about a superflous list of cons. So i am not going to endorse or repeat any. I felt the final battle between the animals was totally unnecessary.I also dont understand why in the last few movies Trex is being projected as kind of a hero and is made to kill the main villain.

The concept and premis for the could have been improved but did a good job of uniting lead characters from the early and later franchised movies.The Kayla Watts character was poorly represented by the actor Dewanda Wise, not a reflection on her acting ability but the casting.The many references to earlier movies and the evolution of Henry Wu was enjoyable.Not perfect but a satisfactory end to the franchise.If I had to rate the franchise in order of personal appreciation I would place it at no. 4.

Enjoy the ride...very good addition to the franchise...being panned by people who don't get it...highly recommend with a big box of popcorn. The back story has pathos if slightly wacky but the dinosaurs are everywhere and that's what it's all about surely.
Dinasoeurs in the cold, where is their food source and Dumb plot if you can get past all the stupidity then i guess movie okay? How is this a 5.7 reviewed on average?

I see I'm the 'bad guy' again, you know, the evil stupid bumbling white male.This movie was... (pick only 3)
a. LONG
b. Diverse
c. Catering to the Alphabet Soup Nazis
d. Boring
e. Cash grab
f. Plotless
g. Pointless
h. RidiculousIn summary... wait for this to be free on late night cable and you require a sleep aid.

I went into this film with high expectations and they were barely met which is okay. This didn't feel like a Jurassic film. It felt like a Mission Impossible movie with dinosaurs. There's some call backs to Kenner artwork which felt like a nice touch. Jeff Goldblum in my opinion carried this film. His character felt the most important. You should never go into this film expecting an Oscar winning script. These films have never made sense so when you apply realism to this franchise resort it to the dinosaurs. I loved the animatronics which made it feel like the first film allot. Don't listen to critics and go see this movie. If you love dinosaurs and you turn your brain off you'll have a great time with friends.

IN A NUTSHELL:
I readily admit that I have been a huge fan of this dinosaur franchise since the very beginning. Not all of the movies in the series have been as good as others, but I've still enjoyed each one. From Jurassic World architect and director Colin Trevorrow, Dominion takes place four years after Isla Nublar has been destroyed. Dinosaurs now live-and hunt-alongside humans all over the world. This fragile balance will reshape the future and determine, once and for all, whether human beings are to remain the apex predators on a planet they now share with history's most fearsome creatures.Movie Review Mom GRADE: BTHINGS I LIKED:
I absolutely loved, loved, seeing the original cast members blend with the newer ones from the final trilogy. So fun! When Chris Pratt found out the old cast was returning, he excitedly claimed, "Just in case you hadn't seen the news. It's finally happening. Get ready for what is absolutely, without a doubt going to be the biggest, baddest and best, movie of the franchise." He also described this final episode like the Marvel "Endgame" of the Jurassic franchise.The cast includes Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Lauren Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill, BD Wong, Campbell Scott, Mamoudou Athie, Omar Sy, among others.There are plenty of action sequences.
