Chris Pratt dropped weight and gained muscles to be in sharp form and is still absolutely believable as the action hero in the movie.I loved that there was a plausible reason for bringing back a biologist and dinosaur expert in this movie.We're also introduced to some new characters.As filmmaking technology improves, the CGI of these movies gets more and more incredible. Even still, this addition to the franchise has even more animatronics than the last 2.There are a lot of respectful nods to the first movie, which made me so happy. Easter eggs abound in visual and spoken forms.We get to see a new kind of dinosaur called a "Pyroraptor." Fun! It was a real dinosaur recently discovered, but its size was supposedly smaller than a turkey.We get to travel to destinations around the world.It cracked me up when Jeff Goldblum's shirt was open and he said, "Oh!" ha ha He had some of the best lines of the movie, as always. There are a few moments worthy of a chuckle.Every dinosaur we know and love from the previous movies gets a decent amount of screen time.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
The last time we saw Ellie Sattler and Alan Grant, they were good friends, so I was surprised when they didn't even hug each other when they were first reunited in this movie.I was surprised by the high number of bad editing moments.I'm sure I'm not the only Jeff Goldblum fan who wanted a more epic moment when we first saw him on screen in this movie.There has been some criticism about the believability of the plot. Agreed.It has been stated that this will NOT be the last film in the Jurassic Park franchise. Did you want this to be? Are you ready for more?It's not really well explained how the land dinosaurs migrated to all of the continents around the world, just that they did.Some of the new characters just aren't very compelling. Some are even annoying.The plot and scenes are pretty chaotic and scattered.I admit that the tension seemed fairly low simply because our favorite characters never seem to die. I wasn't really worried about them and didn't feel as emotionally invested in them as I was in the very first movie. SPOILER: Who knew just holding your hand out in front of a dinosaur was all it took?Soooo many lines are repeated word for word from previous movies in the franchise. The first few times, it was charming, but then it kind of seemed manipulative and even lazy. A lot of the dialogue is clunky. Because of that, some of the acting suffers.Is it terrible and crazy to admit that I was a little bit bored at times?The villains are definitely underwhelming.TIPS FOR PARENTS:
People and animals in perilous situations
Some profanity
A girl flips the bird
Young children might be frightened by the scary dinosaurs.THEMES:
Technology
Nature
Balance
Friendship
Humanity vs. Animals YouTube channel.
Jurassic world dominion is the best movie of the Jurassic park franchise and I hate the it has a bad rating, it doesn't deserve a bad rating. And if you haven't seen it go watch it now.

To paraphrase the great Dr. Ian Malcolm: they were so concerned with whether they could make five Jurassic Park sequels that they didn't think about whether they should make five Jurassic Park sequels. What a piece of junk the latest one is!! It's plodding and predictable. It offers nothing new, just supposed "homages" and Easter eggs. Thankfully I have Regal Unlimited! Two hours and twenty six minutes long and it felt like four hours!! Sam Neill doesn't seem to realize he's supposed to be playing the same character that he did in the original. Chris Pratt is more annoying by the second. I sincerely hope that his MCU role is almost at an end. Didn't Bryce Dallas Howard have a promising career at one point? And she and Laura Dern's Ellie Sadler are total badasses! Until they have to walk over some bugs,...then the shrieking begins. What crap! What tripe! What an utter waste of time!!
This was a hard watch. I'm a big fan of this franchise. The only entertaining parts are about the last 20-30 minutes or so. The action is sub par even then. Save your money and watch it at home.

What a disaster movie. The story is so shallow, predictable with unbelievable actions. With such a good cast, you should make a diamond not this awfulness. Disastrous visual effects. I'm really disappointed as a big fan of Jurassic Park movies.

I felt Dominion was a bit of a Mish mash of Jurassic Park and Jurassic world. We had similarities to both trilogies but not too much that was new and that we had not seen before. Even the ending was similar to Jurassic World 1. I felt like the editing was a bit choppy and it all felt a bit rushed. I've heard a directors cut is coming out, so I do hope it will tidy up the film. It was fun and great to see a mix of the original and sequel casts coming together. I look forward to seeing it again when released on blu ray/iTunes. There were alot of special dinosaur scenes which I loved, but the fact that the films story stretched too so many areas. I think this spoilt the narrative a bit and brought you out of the journey from time to time. I can't wait for the release to own and look forward to the directors cut!

I feel that this final film in the saga goes back to the roots of the original Jurassic park. It focuses on overreach of the power with technology(mainly biotechnology). It was a good way to bring the new cast and original together in a way that felt believable. Also added a couple of great new characters. The realistic true form dinosaurs were quite neat and the touch of nostalgia here and there was great.

It seems like they're running out of ideas to make new movies in the franchise.The movie itself is a good entertainer with very well directed thrill sequences like the chases and human interactions with the mighty predators. In that sense, it a very good watch.What one may be disappointed with is the story line as there is hardly anything novel to offer. They tried to cash in the following of Sam Neill and Laura Dern but that doesn't help beyond a point.I would still recommend it to watch for the execution brilliance of whatever they had on their plate.

A Jurassic Park and Jurassic World mish mash. I could go on and on but I'm tired after struggling through the movie. Using the same old ideas, putting the same old actors with some new ones and adding lots of computer graphics does not mean its will be a good movie. Bigger dinosaurs with more noise is just BORING. I couldn't wait for the movie to end. The scariest part of the movie is that it is doing well at the box-office, so there will probably be another bad sequel. Jurassic Universe - or Multiverse??? Please, think it through or just let it die.

Lots of dinosaurs, action and explosions. It felt like quite a long couple of hours. I thought is was an OK movie and contained all the Jurassic sequel elements you'd expect, but that was about it. I feel pretty bad leaving this as a review considering there was obviously 'no expense spared' in the making of this film and the cast that was put together to bring it to the big screen. But in short it was just OK, not one I'll be looking out for when it if released onto streaming channels.

Everything is said in the title. What a disappointment of a film. A mess from start to finish. It was good to see the return of Sam neill. Jeff goldblum and Laura Dern but it's not interesting at all. I though they could not do any worst than Jurassic World. But this is far worse.
Well the movie is pretty predictable no surprises. We now know however, holding out your right hand will prevent all dinosaurs large or small from eating you. It's the power of the hand!

Watch this movie and watch the original classic Jurassic Park. The contrast is staggering on how stupid and Hollywood these movies have become. It feels like they are trying to capture the same stupidity of the Fast & the Furious franchise's latest entries. The movie has high production value and decent acting but like many Hollywood turds the script is just unbelievably stupid. I absolutely hated Fallen Kingdom for that very reason and this movie is no different. Watch the movie to see how stupid it is for yourself if you don't believe me.

I question those trying to find the meaning of life and Academy Award performances from a dinosaur movie. I found the movie quite entertaining and true to the original Jurassic Park concept. The movie lines up with the old Saturday afternoon thrillers, monster movies and science fiction epics. The movie is fun. That is all one really needs to know.

In my opinion, the mistake lies in having to compare the last film of the saga with the first and unattainable Jurassic Park, and compare Treworrow to Spielberg"Jurassic World Dominion" is not a great movie, nor something that will go down in history like Jurassic Park. It is not a particularly bold or in-depth film in the themes, although we were pleased to see several animatronics as well as the CGIIt remains a good adventure film, in line with the other Jurassic World, even if in my humble opinion, the chorality of the two parallel stories is successful and certainly the old "magical trio" brings something more to the film than the two previous filmsIt is not a hair-pulling film, but certainly a good film, with excellent rhythm, good narrative arc and nostalgic at the right point, without forcibly leveraging the past and giving everyone functional roles to the storyAlthough the main role is entrusted to the new characters, it would be wrong to say that the old ones have been reinserted just for "fanservice", their story is still dealt with in a worthy way and well interpretedBeyond some scientific forcings, however present throughout the franchise which, however, does not want to represent the pure dinosaurs but admittedly allows some legitimate licenses, the film is of a good standard, and indeed has the merit of including other different species of dinosaurs, with scientific accuracy, demonstrating how scientific knowledge has evolvedThe film turned out to be pleasant and I give it, on a scale of 1 out of 10, a good 7, like the first Jurassic World, to which a nice + must be added, thanks to the presence of the performer Jeff Goldblum, the exceptional Laura Dern and the stainless Sam NeillSo the film is more than good for me, I place it only behind the first two of Spielberg and a little above the first Jurassic WorldI do not agree with the reviews that even, at the moment, give it to the last place of the new trilogy (even if it is still early)Something revolutionary or equal to the first film could not be expectedSo it deserves to be seen without the sometimes stereotyped prejudices, of some criticism.
How on earth this damp effort is taking as much as 3x as much as Maverick is beyond me. I am speechless. Revisited way too often to make a credible impact. Overlong and time to call it quits.

Look I know the plot of this movie is all over the place but tbh. I really liked and enjoyed it. Jurassic Park was my childhood, I've watched it so many times and seeing the OG Cast finally back on the big screen made me soo happy. Also I'm a huge Dino-Nerd, so I'm maybe a little bit biased.I really liked that some lesser known or non mainstream "dinos" got the spotlight. The chemistry between the old and new cast worked great. There are many shots/scenes which are really cinematic and look absolutely gorgeous.Overall story/plot is okay but messy, great cast and chemistry, cool dinosaurs that usually don't get enough spotlight, some really cool looking scenes which I would love to have as a wallpaper and lots of fanservice and callbacks to the old movies.

The movie has some good points but is also underwhelming in a lot of others. It was amazing seeing the original cast come back to this film, but it felt like some other things returned from the original jurassic park. There were multiple times this movie where it felt like it was nabbed straight from the original jurassic park, which felt more like lazy writing which did not really do the movie any good.The plot in short was not too good, there were a lot of 'but why?' moments, but then who really goes to a jurassic park/world movie for the amazing plot. The main attraction is, of course, the dinosaurs. The CGI on the dinosaurs was really well done and the action scenes are a thrill to watch! But it does feel like, after five movies, the 'magic' of seeing these dinosaurs on screen is a bit gone. Especially when there is not a big bad evil dinosaur this movie focusses on, like there was in the other jurassic world movies (indominus rex and indoraptor).The acting in this movie was fine, but not outstanding and the plot was, as mentioned, okay at best. The great action scenes and the beautiful scenery and cgi make up for that a bit, though, and I'd say the movie is fun to watch.

Well, I am not surprised by the output of this movie as I did not expect much from it in the first place.This movie follows the same routine of Jurassic World (2015) and Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018), popcorn movies and nothing more.Out of the 6 Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies, the very first Jurassic Park movie (1993) was the most exciting and valuable one to watch.

I don't know where to start, but everything about this movie is actually bad! All the dialogs are out of place! It's full of forced quotes from the previous movies! All the performances are very very awful, even the original cast acted so bad (and we're talking about people like Laura Dern, Sam Neil and Jeff Goldblum). The plot it's so dumb and occasionally nosense! Also photography, directing, visual effects and editing are very low tier if we think about the franchise and the budget!!

You would think that Jurassic World Dominion learn the lessons from Disney Star Wars. Just because you bring back the original Jurassic Park characters they thought they can bring back and it would be successful but not. Poor Laura Dern history repeats itself again.

Having grown up in the 90's Jurassic Park was a big part of my life. I have enjoyed the movies for years. This newest movie is fantastic. I loved it, as did the five other people I went with. It was fun to see all the separate stories come together, and seeing old favorites was exciting. It was all really well done...acting, effects, music, writing, the action, the humor. If you can't enjoy a movie like this, then you want too much.Gone are the days when people can just go to a movie and enjoy it as it is, and not expect it to change their entire life. Movies are meant to be enjoyed, they are meant to take you away for a short time. When did it stop being like that? If you want to be shocked, and scared, and changed...watch the freakin news.

How to make this movie.Step One. Take the Dinosaurs and add every surviving actor from the franchise.Step Two. Take all the previous franchise scripts and select pages at random to create the new script.Step Three. Add lots of screaming and running. Mix and pour.

I will try to keep it short as possible.Starts off as a typical low budget nonsense movie made by college kids then slowly starts to make some sense and rolls out into a coherent plot.The entire setting is completely unrealistic. Ironic it might sound since its fiction but still the main point of my argument is that people would not survive in the world full of dinosaurs. Allegedly the dinos spread the entire world, yeah that means humans would either extinct or be in survival mode.One time they say how living with dinos is a struggle (especially pointed out in the intro) the next we are shown places and events like dinos don't exist at all and somehow the locusts are the only problem...
No other problems, no dinos to make a mess etc. Like make up your mind.The events in the movie are completely off, all the characters would pretty much die off in their 1st crashes and especially their 1st encounters with dinos but they somehow always survive and find their way to a secure place, or secure enough. Magically only the villians get killed almost instant, like magically dinos know who is ''good'' or ''bad''. When a good character is attacked the dinos basically more often just toy around they don't attack for a kill.In the real world, we don't need locusts and dinosaurs to be a problem, we are the biggest problem and we are our own enemy ... the movie seems like a metaphor for a typical brainwashed human behavior, blame everything else but us.This movie is such a mishmash of things, it's like trying hard to please every fanbase there is. Campy horror, JP3 fans (do they even exist...) bringing back old characters and putting lots of nods to old JP1 and 2 but still manage to middle finger it too... this movie seriously doesn't know what it wants to be at all.

Its a generic hollywood blockbuster. Like the other 5 movies before. The story in all movies: people running away and hide from dinos. Thats all. Why do we watch this? We want to see many perfect created dinosaurs. You will get many this time! The story is stupid, of course. But its not an arthouse movie.

This movie is entertaining. For me that was good.I've watched all the other Jurassic movies but I'm not a huge fan to where I'll nitpick every detail. I'm not expecting to see some thought provoking, mind blowing movie with this one. I was entertained and would recommend to anyone else wanting to watch the movie.

The worst thing about writing this review is that I had extremely high hopes for watching this movie. I remember watching the original as a little boy in the theaters being blown away at the ground breaking effects and breakthrough in filmmaking. I was excited to watch this movie with my own children, hoping it would somehow be a repeat of the magic I experienced watching the first one. I also thought thought that this was going to be some sort of homage to the magic of the first movie since they brought back the original cast. When the movie starts, there is no build up to seeing the dinosaurs all of a sudden they just live amongst everyone and the magic of seeing a dinosaur is completely null. I thought there was going to be a very emotional sentiment by seeing the original cast however, it didn't bring any added value other than viewers who remember the original to say oh hey, there they are. The action feels generic, and there was never any points during the movie that gave you the suspense we all experienced during the first one. This was one of the biggest letdowns I have ever had.

Well, well, well. I had so much hope for this movie, I anticipated something really grandiose, but it derailed somewhere.The plot itself was mediocre, but it was obvious, these movies are not really about the plot itself. Maybe, it could have been better with less character lines. I know, I know, it had a great feeling that everyone came back again, and we had new faces, but because of that it became superficial.CGI itself, good as always. The dinosaurs were great, their movement, fight scenes and the landscapes as well where we could find them. However I could not understood, why they had to finish the movie with that fight scene. I don't really see the point in it, but it is my problem.2,5 hours of playing time. Too much, definitely. You get so many boredom parts in the movie, which scenes are not neccessary in my opinion. I was anticipated a little more fights with that screen time.Overall, it was not the worst movie ever, but definitely the worst, out of the 3 movies. I don't regret that I spent money on it, but it is not going to become my favourite. If you have some superfluous time and money, it worth a movie ticket.

Bad acting or directing? Maybe too small a sound stage with too much green screen? Everybody always seemed to be standing so close to each other. I dunno, it felt low-budget, and maybe even lazy because they didn't seem to be trying to being anything new to the table. Just resting on their laurels to bring in the views.Anyway, I didn't feel the nostalgia for the first movie like I think I was supposed to, I used the fast-forward button a lot - which I never do the first time I watch a film - and I just couldn't find myself "in it" like I did in most of the others.It's too bad, too, because I would really have liked to feel that nostalgia and I *really* wanted to suspend my disbelief.This is a rare review from me. I'm actually sorry that I felt I needed to write it.

Thank you Chris & keep up the good work. Entertaining and mostly clean! I appreciate it! Today's family wants to take all the kids to a movie together. We highly appreciate a film that doesn't make us squirm from inappropriate garbage. I'm thankful for Vid Angel because I use it to clean up what we watch at home. I decide to watch whatever the bleep I want it hear what I want instead of garbage. Parents is time to take out the garbage
I support clean family movies!Thank you Chris!

This was so fun to watch!, I really think this was a great ending for the famous Jurassic World movies... the plot was amazing, the new dinosaurs species made me have actual fear HAHA, but in general I'll give this a 7 out of 10.

It needs a special kind of stupid incompetence to have so much budget and so many stars and still produce total crap.What did they try to achieve ?A mission impossible clon with spontanous dinosaur appearances ?A James Bond cover with some snakeskin ?A fast and furious remake on the lizard side ?No one will ever know.Only thing that remains sure is:
This is the end of Jurassic Park,
the whole franchise,
forever.

As a fan, it's everything you would want. I'm not going to do any spoilers but obviously the original crew is in the movie and the most recent characters are also featured and it is a great and balanced combination of the current and previous generation.

We watched it and enjoyed it. It is a sixth installment. Those are usually terrible and enjoyed mostly by people who enjoy repetitiveness. We didn't get that vibe here. It felt like closing the circle with the iconic first movie. Perhaps people keep expecting another experience like in 1993, but that's impossible because that was the only time we were able to be vowed by a very first seemingly realistic look at dinosaurs. It was mind blowing. But that can never be recreated.Of course, this installment has no unexpected plot. If it did, THAT would actually kill the vibe. This movie is based on nostalgia, on the joy of getting the old trio of Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum back together and them meeting the Jurassic World leads.We were very pleasantly surprised and liked 6 better than 4 and 5. Or even 2 and 3. They did fine with this!

The potenial was there but this movie didn't make any sense, poor plot, wooden characters, no depth. Left the cinema wondering what I just watched. Doesn't even have good dinosaur battles. Poor film. Please save your money and go to top gun: maverick if you want to see a good movie this summer.

It was a great way to end the series. It was great seeing all the original characters back from the first movie in 1993. So long ago. I give them credit for showing how mankind lives with dinosaurs now instead of the usual dinosaurs escaping from captivity and they have to out run them. There were a few points in the movie where the dialogue seemed choppy however there was plenty of action and plenty of dinosaurs and I thought the actors were terrific. I saw Top Gun Maverick a few weeks ago which is a repeat from an older movie and I thought they did a better job on that one however Jurassic World is still very good!

One of worst written and directed big budget movies I've seen in a long time. Made Transformers look like Seventh Seal.It starts with the 4 minutes of narration at the beginning to try to make the rest of it make any kind of sense. This fails. Then there are the other obvious re-shot or dubbed lines to try to make things make sense. These also fail.Forget the black ops CIA agents easily defeating humans armed with machine guns, then throwing their guns down and turning their backs when confronted with some dinosaurs trained to literally run up and bite them. Forget that the controls for the mainframe that needs to be turned off is in the same room where they kept the experimental grasshoppers and which had been soaked in lighter fluid and set on fire earlier. Forget that restarting the mainframe also brought the grasshoppers who were burned to a crisp hours earlier back to life. Forget all that, and answer this: Did Kayla steal that airplane from Baloo from TailSpin? It's obviously the same plane, did she pay for it? Do talking bear pilots exist in the Jurassic Park universe?

I am a huge Jurassic Park fan, and the 1st movie was and always will be one of my favorite movies that I've ever seen in theaters.All these new dinosaur species but not enough present on screen.Whenever action starts it goes by so quickly...I think Jurassic World movies should be more about dinosaurs, not about human characters and their relationships...Looks like Hollywood is determined to ruin every single 80s and 90s cult movie.

'Jurassic World Dominion' (or Jurassic Park 6) is the presumed end of this second trilogy. It primarily follows Owen (Pratt), Claire (Howard) & their adopted daughter Maisie (Sermon), as she's hunted/kidnapped by bad guys that think she's a clone. Then they throw in the original team of Ellie (Dern), Alan (Neill, struggling to find his accent from the original film) and Ian (Goldblum) who are working to bring down Biosyn Corp and their GE locusts, led by Dodgson (Scott). They have help from Kayla (Wise), Ramsay (Athie) and Barry (Sy), and BD Wong is also back as Dr Wu.While the premise of dinosaurs roaming wild is an interesting concept, it's not fully explored and only hinted at in parts. Where it is shown, such as Owen wrangling the Parasaurolophus, there's more questions as to the potential realness of it, i.e. Reptiles living in the snow, horses being as fast as them, their calmness. There's a lot of "really?!" moments in this film. There's some funny moments and some good action scenes, but it all seems to have too many chefs and lack focus/seems rushed.This is nowhere near the quality of the original film - probably slightly better than 'Jurassic Park III' and 'Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom', not that that means much. Oddly, while we see a few dinosaurs, including some new ones, but mostly the tried & tested favourites - there seems to be not that many scenes where dinosaurs are the main focus. While not horribly slow, it doesn't feel like it all comes together and starts working until the final 40min, which isn't much of the 2 hour 20min running time.

This movie relies on fan service by bringing back the old characters from Jurassic park, but they forget to write a story. They should of killed off some of the characters in this movie cause any one who is about to die (get eaten by a dinosaur) another character will arrive just in time to save them, I mean come on this is final movie why didn't they kill off anyone, the only characters that die is the villain, and random background characters. Owen's daughter ( I don't remember her name nor do I care) just says something sassy, and has zero character even though she is the plot of this movie. The actress also does a bad accent through out the film and its just so annoying.

Plenty of action, some impressive sequences, and fun (unlike JP: Fallen Kingdom which was just miserable). If you're expecting "high art" (when has JP ever been that?) you'll be disappointed, but if you've plenty of popcorn and are out for an evening without having to think too much, it's good value entertainment.

Why JW Dominion is The worst JW ever?!!1. The script is extremely weak.2. Bring back the old character only for money.3. Its so predicatable.(there is more.)The only thing they care is add L.gbt character in story,i don't have problem with them but in every movie i recently watched they added by force even at the cost of destroying the story.

Jurassic Park was my childhood. When the movie came out in theaters, I was only 1 years old. I remember owning Jurassic Park years later on vhs, and it becoming one of my most prized possessions. The story, characters, pacing, special effects, and music are pitch perfect. When the Lost World: Jurassic Park came out, I was 5 years old, and I did not see it in theaters either. While it was a flawed sequel, I enjoyed watching it on vhs. The music, set pieces, and the inclusion of more dinosaurs made it a fun addition to the series. Jurassic Park III was the first film in the franchise that I actually saw in theaters in 2001. I remember loving it when I was 9 years old, but now it is my least favorite of the sequels. The runtime is too short, and I'm not just referring to humans running away from dinosaurs. The dialogue and characters and poorly written, and the quality of the cgi was downgraded. With that being said, the animatronic work still mostly holds up, except the Spinosaurus. Fast forward 14 and 17 years later, and I finally saw both Jurassic World and Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom in theaters. The experience of seeing the park finally open in Jurassic World was such an en incredible feeling. It was the closest to capturing the magic of the original Jurassic Park. Jurassic World Fallen Kingdom, like Jurassic Park III, tends to get better when repeat watches, but it is a lesser sequel in almost every way. This brings me to Jurassic World Dominion. While the film does have tonal issues and missteps, seeing the original trio together is worth the price of admission alone. While I think the current reviews are a bit harsh, the film is flawed. I would summarize the biggest issue as missed opportunities for the characters and story. The movie wraps up all six films in an interesting enough way, but doesn't completely satisfy or answer every question that you may have. Visually, the movie is gorgeous, and it has the most animatronics of any film in the franchise, with the cgi mixing well with the practical effects. Overall, Jurassic World Dominion is a nostalgic rollercoaster ride that thrilled me, slightly disappointed me, but never bored me.

Top Gun sequel took 4 or 5 steps up compared to the first, while Dominion took 4 or 5 steps down. There were a lot of action scenes that were OK to watch, and some were actual fun to. The problem is the story did not, at all, have the suspense of the first one. It never drew you into the plot, it just became too preachy. Sad, since it could have been good, but it wasn't.

Lots of meaningless action. Same old boring predictable near death experiences. Feels like it was written so badly to make sure it's the last one. Script older than the dinosaurs. Relying on the mix of actors to get bums on seats. I'd recommend not bothering to be one of them bums on seats.

There's a few low scores on this film, but overall I enjoyed it.Yes I agree the story line isn't the best in the world, but what do you expect, it's going to be about dinosaurs, people being bad, and people being nibbled a bit... it's what all the other films where about!Perhaps 7 is a little high, but I'll stick with it - I enjoyed the film. If you liked the other ones, the chances are you'll like this one.

Imagine the fast and furious franchise made a b-grade, straight to dvd, attempt at a remake of the original. It has the same cast and crew, but they're all washed up, sad and lonely and then blatantly scripted the same lines and scenes as the first film?! But they don't care anymore; it's been done to death and even the script writer's busy going to parties, getting high and smashing French champagne. They're all done with Toretto's, over the franchise, over worked, and legitimately now only in it for the money....
It's like that, but with dinosaurs.

Let's just hit the important stuff first. As far as the action goes, it's a Jurassic Park movie. Of course the action is going to be a lot of fun. Some fun, some intense, and creative dinosaur action happened, and it was engaging. With that said...The story had potential. It was handled very poorly. I wished that they made me truly care about these characters, particularly Chris Pratt, and Bryce Dallas Howard, but the character arcs were weak sadly. Instead of developing interesting character arcs, that got replaced with the nostalgia factor, (which for the record, Sam Neil, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum still got it.)And honestly the film itself could've been shorter. It did feel like it dragged on unfortunately. There were also some character decisions that kind of made scratch my head and was like, "huh?" The music was forgettable unfortunately. There's a lot of flaws to this film that I could list. But, there is still some fun that could be found in this. One watch is enough.C-

There is never any really any sense of danger and the plot, if you can call it that, just quietly plays out. One of the few movies I wish was shorter.Not even the dinosaurs were as good as in the earlier installments.In the end its a sad waste of talented actors who combined with a little bit of nostalgia provide just enough to call it a movie.

This movie took awhile to get going. They were doing so much building of the plot it felt like it was never gonna start. Once it got going and this dinosaur movie had some good dinosaur action, it was pretty enjoyable.It is a long line of pretty good movies that I'm glad we are getting, but that's all they are, pretty good, not great.

The reunion of characters and iconic scenes can warm the heart of any Jurassic Park fan, however outside of those moments, the story fails to stand on its own. It seems the direction of the film is often sidetracked by implementing these nostalgic moments, even some iconic dinosaurs were merely reduced to memories of better scenes in the past.

Love how they took from the first movie and honored it by adding little Easter eggs. The cast was amazing and it wasn't drawn out the plot was to the point. One of my favorite out of the entire series.

If you are a fan of dinosaurs fighting each other, this movie is for you. If you are a fan of suspenseful moments where dinosaurs are hunting humans and the humans are trying to escape death, boy, you're in for a real treat. I was in awe by the action scenes in this movie and how realistic the graphics of the dinosaurs were. The last section of the movie is packed with dinosaur fighting scenes, you'll love it. There were a few notable scenes, especially the ones with the baby raptor dinosaur, where it looked TOO fake with too much CGI because it didn't blend well with the forest background. It didn't detract too much from the immersion of the movie but it was definitely noticeable.The story was decent. It does a decent job of recapping the previous movie story a little bit. You will greatly benefit if you remember what happened in the earlier movies because they pretty much get into the story and continue it. The relationship between the characters will make much more sense if you remember what they did in the past. I didn't like how the movie just drops newly introduced characters. Especially in the first half, there are times where they introduce a new actor and then the story changes locations and you never see that actor again. They introduce dinosaurs that react to lazer pointers but you never see them again after that.I'm not a big fan of the middle part since it drags on a little bit. The part where people are sneaking into the lab and there's heavy dialog wasn't presented interesting enough to me..The acting is superb from all the actors. The way they acted terrified from these fake CGI dinosaurs were very believable. Jeff Goldblum was funny and talked eloquently as he always does. The audience at my movie theatre laughed at some of his dialog. I didn't see the other jurassic park movies from the 90's with the original actors. But i still felt like i this was going to be epic when the original actors and the new actors from the jurassic world story arc joined together.I'm not a huge fan of the villain, he was evil but his motivation other than greed money was kinda shallow. He was also kind of weak, depending totally on his workers to just blindly follow him.All in all, come for the action and suspense. You'll appreciate this movie so much more if you remember the previous movies and if you know the actors from their other movies.

Sure, it was not the best of the JP movies. (Jurassic Park and Jurassic World were my favorites.) But it certainly was not as bad as some of the other reviews stated. And it was better than some of the other sequels they have been churning out.My husband and I thought the movie was pretty good (my husband often falls asleep during the bad ones), and I really enjoyed seeing all the characters from the JP movies come together (even if it was near the end). I thought that the movie would have been better if it were edited down to 2 hours; it was a bit long (I was looking at my watch near the end of the movie) and cutting it back would have made the plot tighter and the movie more interesting.

I have to admit, I had such high hopes for this movie after seeing Fallen Kingdom and absolutely loving it. However, Dominion fell short on so many things. Yes, the original cast was reunited and that would normally make the film better, but the movie just felt rushed and the actors just didn't have that spark that they did in previous movies. I would have liked to see much more dinosaur action, though. I mean, if you're going to give us a confusing enough storyline to follow that branches off into so many directions in Dominion, at least include the animal that made the franchise so popular. Maisie was really annoying and just not a likable character, and her storyline was very stupid, in my opinion. She was just another character, easily forgettable. I ended up almost falling asleep because Dominion was just so boring and the storyline was hard to catch up with. Watched it with my grandparents in the theater and was very underwhelmed, and watched it with my parents and they said it was garbage. It's a shame, because the movie had so much potential, but they didn't plan it out right and it was just another forgettable film of 2022. Very disappointed in the movie.

Well......i went to see this with low expectations after the reviews i read and the negative comments and although the movie indeed suffered here and there and had serious flaws still overall it was enjoyable and had more positives than negatives so it was better than i expected it to be.Overall.......first half an hour was not bad although it could have done more with the story and it was great to see the couple from the jurassic world 1 and 2 films now living together up in the woods with that kid but after that we got like another half an hour of useless chaces with dinos in a kind of a city like mad max atmosphere boredoom but then the movie was fixed and last half an hour was great showing an epic battle between t-rex and gigantosaurus but there should have been more dino battles during the film. Overall not near as good as the previous two JW films but still it was above average and on the plus u get to see also dr alan grant and his love affair from the original 1993 film and of course jeff was back as well. The original cast we all loved was a plus and reason enough to watch this film. If u like dinos films then u should add this to your dvd collection when it's out and complete your DVD JP FILM COLLECTION.GRADE C+

Jurassic Park meets James Bond, No story and pretty ordinary action sequences. What happened to this franchise. The original cast meets the new cast a mish mash of cliches and new cgi that just doesn't work. Watching movie reminded of a theme park ride rather a movie. Should stop at 3 maybe even 1 Hollywood keep churning out this garbage.

I didn't like this movie as much as the previous ones. Pratt who is supposed to be the main guy, doesn't get as much air time as other boring characters. Claire's facial expressions were very good. It was good to see some old characters but I kept wanting to see Pratt more. And I hate all this "girl is the key to everything" crap. The black actress was an interesting character. The chase scenes were the only really enjoyable parts. But unfortunately once again the character writing is bad as with other Hollywood movies. But at least it wasn't as woke as other movies.
This is the perfect film for 4DX. Full of nostalgia too. Any Jurassic fan can enjoy this installment if you just go with an open mind and not nitpicking the script.

Gonna cut right to the chase and say die hard fans of the jurassic series will love this one, including myself. Compared to the first 2 jurassic world movies, this was an improvement. But by all means, this movie was good, but not great. I didn't enjoy jurassic world because it felt like a bad attempt at a remake of jurassic park. And don't get me started on fallen kingdom, I don't know how I sat through that movie when it was in theaters. It was just so awful, the worst jurassic movie of them all. So my expectations for this movie were pretty low. This is what the first jurassic world movie should have been. It reminded me of the rise of the planet of the apes series. But, If you're looking for a realistic interpretation of how dinosaurs would live among humans, this movie isn't for you. This movie is purely entertainment. If it were realistic the main characters would've been dead a long time ago. The action can be cheesy and predictable, but it's fun, and some of the action sequences had me ready to jump, something i haven't felt since the first jurassic park. This movie was definitely carried by the return of the original jurassic park cast, i would not have enjoyed it as much as i did if they weren't in it. This movie actually felt like it had somewhat of a plot. And somehow still doesn't feel like the end of the series. I would not be mad if they made another jurassic world movie, as long as they continue to expand the world of the story.

Jurassic park was a masterpiece of a film and these new films have slowly killed its reputation. Even the cgi is worse. Creativity in films as died in recent years and this film proves it. The old cast should of been embarrassed to sign up.

Very boring with slow start .. not for entertainment of kids. Story a bit complicated. One of the interesting scientists resembled Dr. Fauci, who did some shady research too. Actions were thrilling and interesting.
Why is the corporate always the villain. Time for realty check, the true heroes of todays world are the big industries. Time to grow up from unrealistic plots.

The build up to this feature seems somewhat fake: being the idea that we'll see the world ravaged by the impact of these dinosaurs finally free to live unfettered and feast on the 7 billion of us, many of whom anticipated a thrilling end to the saga. Even the title "Dominion" suggests some victorious claimant of Terra Firma as we expect to be the ones cast back into evolutionary obscurity in a battle which humans haven't a chance of winning. Well, that's what it suggested anyway, the trailer, the title, that we'd see the world overrun. But instead, the writers seem to have shuffled through all of the prior films and screenplays and then finally picked up Michael Crichton's first book and said, "eh I've bright idea ... let's set it in a park for Dinosaurs like l, eh I dunno ... Jurassic Park maybe, huh?" Duh!And that's precisely what we get, Jurassic Park again, only worse, way worse. Couple that with rubber animatronics, bad CGI, wooden acting and we're left with a giant pile of Dino-dung that stinks. Any menace one might have expected from the world being the dominion of these creatures dissappears when they decided to concentrate on an environmental disaster caused by locusts the size of rats and forget that there are flocks of Pterosaurs on high that just might eat the kids for lunch, but they won't because we've decided that we can all hold a hand up in a staying manner and control every single one of them, and if that doesn't work we'll just get Chris Pratt to talk to them, he's great at that and they seem to like his voice. He even teaches Dr Grant how to hold a hand up to a Velociraptor, unaware that Dr Grant perfected the staying hand in JP III.And the decision to have the Pilot for hire explain to the dinosaur trainer and the former head of Jurassic World the names and characteristics of certain dinosaurs seems so lazy and ill-thought out as to be ridiculous. It is an obvious attempt to give the character lines, but simply isn't believable.If only the writers of this rubbish would embrace prehistory, for their work certainly needs somewhere to go to, preferably into obscurity.Instead they brush over the fact that the thing which was to avoided at all costs throughout all of the prior movies, that these animals shouldn't ever be set free, really isn't that bad and we'll all have to learn to share. It's an insulting side-step, insulting to fans, and to concentrate the majority of the film in yet another Dinosaur park, left me dumbfounded, I still can't believe they went there.The return of the original cast was largely wasted and there was no intelligent integration of their roles with the Jurassic World cast, it was a wasted opportunity and the promise of the trailers and excitement at this merging was squandered. The one sure thing to create atmosphere, John William's renowned score was also wasted and the music at times was so bad, it sounded like a score for any generic TV action show. Only hints of the original score surfaced and were so clipped as to be annoying and pointless.If they had crowd-sourced ideas from the fans and thrown it all in the air and grabbed what they could, they could have done way better than what was written here. And, I can only say that the opening to this film is one of the most crappy wasted opportunities of all the franchise, opening with some ridiculous newsreader monologue segment as a mechanism to get the story into our heads. It was terrible and some of the worst writing I've seen across a franchise known for enticing, exciting openings. It seems the old saying, too many cooks spoil the broth, is appropriate to the writing here.The acting seems rushed, unfocused, and unrehearsed and a lot of that is down to the director, who is ultimately responsible for shouting cut. Overall, it's a huge disjointed, disappointment that even the cast seem perplexed by.If looking for wonder, rewatch the original, if you do so after watching this mess, then you'll realise exactly how bad it is.

If you liked the Jurassic Worlds (1&2) and loved Jurassic Park (1), you'll have loads of things to like in this movie too. But I'm biased, the movie has dinosaurs, was filmed partly in Malta while I lived there (we had news of the movie every day haha) AND in my favourite place on earth: the Dolomites.

This movie is amazingly bad. A series of scenes which don't seem to have a real connection, but angry dinosaurs being involved. It seems like seeing the same sequence multiple times, once in a city, a forest, a frozen lake, but it's basically all the same. What really baffles me is the complete lack of character development. Basically every character remains flat and ends up where he has been before. This is the worst movie I have seen in a long time.

I went into this 6th instalment of the Jurassic saga with a lot of trepidation. All the negative reviews had me lower my expectations.And you know what? It's not as awful as everyone made it out to be.Not as good as the original trilogy nor the 4th entry, Jurassic World. But it's definitely miles better than Forbidden Kingdom.Having the original trio of Neill, Dern and Goldblum reprising their classic roles, did bring more nostalgia than I anticipated. Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard, the hero's of the new trilogy, were definitely pushed into the backseat for this new film.But it was fun popcorn entertainment with some stunning visuals and action packed set pieces laced with tension.Sure, the whole "locust" subplot felt out of place and stupid, but it didn't impact my enjoyment one bit.It's a fine addition to the franchise. Maybe not the send off we wanted, but not awful either.

I rarely blame the writer for a bad movie as more than often it's the result of a studio or producer's ego - but the writing was objectively poor.The industry has been so hot on Carmichael for awhile, and honestly, it seems like she had never even watched Jurassic Park or read Crichton's books. It felt more like Fast & Furious plus dinosaurs with sappy dialogue and non-sensical plot points, one after another. And even though we have an army of characters that barely got any development, the story insisted on introducing more, which were boring additions.Clearly this story also was pushing some agendas, and its painful philosophical discussions make the OG movie sound like Socrates and Plato compared to this rubbish.Just look at the ridiculous outfits Emily Carmichael wears to premieres, and tell me this person should be writing the Jurassic Park franchise...If you're going to make another Jurassic Park film, get a writer who lives and breathes this franchise, who knows the book by heart and is bursting with creativity - not the hot writer agents tell you to work with.

I loved every minute of this movie! It had a bit of a slow start to build the context, but then, it got packed with non stop action, chases and suspense.For me, the movie scored really high for the following points:
Revisited the old characters and showed us what they are doing now, plus we got some nice touching scenes (maybe a bit of clich√© here and there, but nothing exaggerated)Main focus was still on the new characters (from the Jurassic World series) and got them to merge nicely with the old ones, share screen time and exchange jokesScared me and made me jump in my seat (happened at least 3 times)Provided me with more than a couple of crazy chases / dinosaur encounters that made me feel like I was part of the scenes, kept me in a nonstop tense mood while my brain is completely frozen by the spectacular camera shotsProbably the people that scored this film low, confused it with something else. It's a Jurassic World film, so go there to enjoy the cinematic experience, not with some unrealistic expectation of a complex story-telling and character development.Remember Michael Bay's Transformers movies? It's that much fun! It's got lots of dinosaurs (old and new ones), lots of fights/chases, lots of action, hell yeah! What more could you wish for? Best movie in the entire francize for me.

You know what? The nostalgia sorta works here for me. It's endearing, to see the old cast again, some iconic scenes recreations, now with a sort of poke at the generational gap, I dig it. It brought me back a piece of my childhood and a movie ain't good unless it can connect you to something. I don't watch Jurassic Park for perfect plot lines or complexities, I do it for the majestic Dino recreation. This one just works.There are also some very uniquely terrifying situations and I've seen every which genre of thriller/horror so that was kinda nice. The actors were all playing their character really well and they all seems to genuinely like working with each other.Overall I liked everything.

I was fan of Jurassic world part 1 and 2. So I expected more from part 3. And seriously after seeing the disaster part 3, it will be shame to call me as a Jurassic fan. They don't apply any good story, just made it for money. But u lost our love and respect.

If they had focused more on how awesome it would of looked day to day for Dinosaurs and animals and humans co-existed after the previous films. It could have been jaw dropping.So many characters the dinosaurs were more like extras!This is the first film I had no jumps or felt zero tension.Thank god we finally saw the Dimetrodon.I just wish after films the plesiosaur got some screen time.Sad it was in production this long and we got an action film not a dinosaur film.

All this movie has to offer is cliches and boring plots. Not much of interest happens and all of it feels like the movie needed to check a couple of Jurassic world/park movie boxes and then they were finished.

Not sure why this has such a low score. It's full of action, dinosaurs and nostalgic cheese. Just sit back and enjoy. IMDB is going to get ruined by ridiculous scores. There is no way this deserves so many low ratings. If you don't like it, fine! Let's add some *'s for production, acting, sound, effects and entertainment value.

I... enjoyed it. But. Just enjoyed. The best part of the movie was the return of the original cast. Jeff Goldblum of course was phenomenal and fell right back into the role of Ian Malcolm. We gotta all be honest here though... the first two movies of JP were amazing because they were done by Spielberg and based on the books. Everything after just feels like a cheap rip off.

I'm just at the intro and I'm laughing so hard. Considering these are dangerous creatures. They are not like bears or lions. These are bigger, faster, and eat much more, the goverments would surely contain them and just make another jurassic world island to contain them all rather than making them live freely in the city.How many people would get eaten + pets too!!Im surprised they only have 37 deaths in the past year too. That number would surely be up considering how dangerous the ocean would be + flying as well.This is like some fanfiction story that bend reality and logic and much worst. The rest of the story doesn't help much.
It's exactly what the movie should be. It calls back to the first three, it reminds you of the excitement of the first one, it brings everyone together and ties the story up. I really enjoyed it.
Plot is decent. No real need to develop new characters. It is fun, fast paced and not so gory. It was a good way to wrap things up. It was better then the second one of this Trilogy.

I'd heard it was bad..but I've been a die hard fan of Jurassic Park since I saw it at the cinema on my 13th birthday. All I can say is that I really do hope that this film franchise is now dead and extinct forever, because it was TERRIBLE!The characters, I didn't care about. Dodgson even less. It was nice to see the three original characters back together but the story and bad writing overshadowed all of this. The story was so long winded and boring that I nearly turned it off midway. I only finished it (and that was incredibly difficult) because I felt I owed it to Jurassic park to finish the final installment.Instantly forgettable, forever regrettable. You will be wasting your time watching this..it's all been done and been seen in the previous five movies. Shame but like most things, it's had it's day and unfortunately it was on my 13th birthday!

The first Jurassic Park was a thought-provoking science fiction film with enormous entertainment value.But after the first film, pseudoscientific realism was thrown in the trash can, emphasis was placed just on the popcorn factor, making these movies falling into the spectrum of a good visual festival with a mediocre narrative.This film is perhaps the one that takes this principle further. The story is generic, it serves as a pretext to go from action scene to action scene, with dinosaurs, explosions, bar fights, impossible pursuits with vehicles on land and in the air.However, it still has some well-crafted nostalgia factor. I really enjoyed seeing Sam Neill, Laura Dern and Jeff Goldblum together once again. And to the film's credit, these characters are more than glorified appearances, taking up quite a bit of space in the film.Conclusion: It's a brainless action movie with plenty of nostalgia, good character moments, and a corny b-plot narrative that is very bland and shallow.I enjoyed this movie more than the previous one. If you don't expect much from it, it might be fun.
That gives it a leg up over other franchises.Otherwise, it's bloated, confusing and unearned. Disappointing ending to this franchise. Hope to see more.

So amazing CGI dinosaurs is old stuff now. Been there, done that. World Dominion is going for the nostalgic play by bringing back the original cast of the 1993 "Jurassic Park". That was cool, but somehow even with the original stars, the old magic could not be restored. The Francise has run its course, and the way they left it does not sit right with me. Dinosaurs have a right to live alongside us? That seems terrifying and not a happy way to leave things. I still give this movie a 7 due to exciting action scenes. I often found I was tensing in suspense from the action. And that is really what you come to expect from these movies; good dinosaur action.

Dominion had a rough initial start. But it thankfully ramps up the fun the more the movie gets going. But seriously, lets never do that cringeworthy introduction video of a modern day news feed again, it genuinely felt like a parody or comedy but no-one in the theater was laughing. This type of start obviously gave me a hard time to get into the movie. The dialog is under-par, the characters are meh, and people are sitting around a too much for what is a world filled with dinosaurs. Also, realistically speaking, no current day government would ever allow these dinosaurs to just roam around. So you really do need to allow some fantasy, even though this show tries to be real (like that news feed segment).But then, the trip to Malta happens and imo this is where the movie kicks off and pretty much does. Not. Let. Go. It's almost action piece after action piece. First off the Malta scenes reminded me a ton of a watching a James Bond movie. The action directing is absolutely excellent here and really engaging. It genuinely caught me off guard how good it was and I was finally hooked into the movie. Then a bit later then reintroduce the original characters, now I already knew this before hand, so no surprises for me, but it was nice seeing them and they at least had something to do, except for Ian Malcolm who was a bit more absent. Regarding the original characters, there are a few but imo not excessive amount of call backs/nostalgia hooks. The only one I thought was a bit much was having Malcolm distract the dino with a torch again, oh well, you know what you are getting into. Also the Barbasol can had no place whatsoever in this movie, felt really random.There are enough dinosaurs here to satisfy your needs, at least mine were met well enough. If I'd had to guess we've had more encounters than any previous movie. And with the disappointment that was Fallen Kingdom and it's awful auction plot this was a return to form imo. The types of dinosaurs are also fantastic, loved that they tried to do some new stuff and also bring in some new development in how some dinosaurs might have looked (feathers). What is a running theme though is that the dinosaurs a lot of the times just ''appear'' out of thin air it seems, they might have a short announcement of a yell or something but they pop up everywhere. That does in turn make encounters less impactful.Directing overall was good, though the action directing being the standout. Acting was all good, didn't really expect anything surprising from these actors and their characters didn't require much range besides Bryce which did great.Characters, I only have a gripe with the main ''villain'' who they made a current day awkward billionaire CEO, he looked like he walked straight out of the Apple building. Imo, this didn't really work for me. He wasn't annoying enough to be funny, nor evil enough to be hated and feel the satisfaction when he is down on his luck. His decisions are weird, and overall it just felt like a character that wasn't real. The clone girl storyline was improved, it was basic but it needed to be done for her to have any meaning in the movie, though her scenes still felt like ''get it over with''.Music was pretty good, they brought back some of the Williams stuff but kept it subtle, which I think was a tasteful decision not to go overboard. But it shows that the JW trilogy lacks a good score. The music for action scenes once again was good too, and they opted for some action scenes to not use any music which I can appreciate, it just adds that bit more intensity when the music is gone.The movie ends again sadly with a bit of that cringe worthy writing that it started with, so...wish they didn't do that. Character storylines are wrapped up vaguely, guess they keep them open for whatever comes next.All in all I had more fun here than I expected.
Another case of a film better left unmade- just designed to suck money out of people. Actors were great, story was just a rehash of everything before.

Wow, is anyone really surprised that review bombing is becoming the new past time for people who have nothing better to do? This movie rules. Please do not listen to all these negative reviews. This is easily one of the best films in the franchise!

Due to this film being one of the first films being filmed in lockdown it really wasnt that bad. I felt the dialogue was a bit messy especially when Alan Grant and Ellie are speaking with the antagonist at the beginning. However, there were some good scenes, but again like most films it was in the trailer. Apart from that the detail on the dinosaurs is astonishing and where there is action there really isn't anything wrong with it.Slow beginning and an alright ending. I would recommend watching it though.

Don't care what the critics said, the film is fine, with the cast from original JP, wat else can u demand more?The franchise is too expensive to end, there will be more in future, and tat time I will bring my kids to watch, to continue the legacy.The sad thing about this film is the soundtrack "Welcome to Jurassic World" doesn't played much in this finale, it is a very powerful, touching and touching music.

Is it great? No. Can you be entertained while watching it? Absolutely. Know what you are going into - this is no where near the caliber of the first one (or any blockbuster hit, for that matter), but if you go in with the mindset that "This will not be good", you will enjoy yourself.
No resemblance to anything related to the franchise. Please disregard this mess and hopefully they will make another actual Jurassic park movie to finish the series. No excuse for this crap.

Continuing the Jurassic Park franchise tradition of every subsequent sequel being weaker than the previous one, Jurassic World Dominion is as embarrassing & incompetent as any blockbuster can get. An insipid, moronic & lacklustre entry with nonsensical plot, soulless characters & dull action, this sixth & final instalment is possibly the weakest of all entries in the series and is one of the worst films of the year so far.Directed by Colin Trevorrow (Jurassic World), the film picks what Fallen Kingdom had setup with its ending and discards it for a much safer, less ambitious & far more idiotic premise. And then it fails at executing that properly too. The new characters are cringe, reprising ones remain just as uninteresting as they were before and they also make the original trio return to pander fans, pick an easy paycheck & add nothing to the saga.The film suffers from not having a clearly defined set of priorities. It wants to be too many things yet ends up being nothing but a waste of time & money. For a plot set in a world now run over by dinosaurs, the possibilities were endless yet it spends too much time on characters investigating a conspiracy and narrates it with such ineptitude that we are never invested in it. And if that isn't enough, the editing on display is an absolute horror show.Overall, Jurassic Park Dominion doesn't have an ounce of magic, wonder or sense of adventure that the series once basked in and is a bland, generic, emotionally vacant & creatively bankrupt conclusion to a franchise that should've remained a duology at best. Blockbuster filmmaking at its most hollow, this film not only makes the same mistakes as before but also several new ones and despite few crowd-pleasing dino set pieces, it remains a forgettable ride.

The film was really a last Goodbye saying thing.Nice to watch, well done, digital perfection, nice entertainment but easy to forget again.But I do not regret, that I watched the last film of this kind.But do not forget > we are the Dinos now!
Worth checking out. Great closure to the series. Don't listen to the critics, just go and have a great time! Loved that the old cast came back to join the new cast. We'll done everyone!
Terrible acting. Horrendous and ridiculous story and hardly any dinosaurs.Evil Tim Cook's acting was so terrible it was laughable.Total mess of a final movie. Skip this one.

This is less about the warnings of man playing god and our creation tuning on us and more that man is just awful and really bad because we are breathing and exist, rather than correct the mistake, let's conserve them and complain about us and the resolve is surprising giving the original premise.

I love the Jurassic Park franchise and this had good moments but the story was a bit flat. The original characters were great to see together again and their little personal moments were fantastic but the dinosaurs were almost secondary. It was almost like it was about the young girl.The original Jurassic Park had science fiction but it was really believable and the story was fantastic with great characters too. The first Jurassic World recaptured this and stretched out the reality but that was fine but the story in this one wasn't the best.I think it is time to leave this franchise now and let it go down as one of the best in the last 30 years.

TERRORble. My new word just for this movies. It really encompasses all aspects including acting, directing, music and plot.Like anything in an inflationary environment, you get poor value for bloated costly actors and the Hollywood industry. Go see Maverick....a properly done sequel.

Lots of cgi as usual, with creatures chasing people, as usual, but they seem to have spent more time focusing on the female action girl quota than they did on any story. Oh, the acting is poor and unconvincing too. Just watch some David Attenborough stuff instead....

This plot was so god awful and was bad to watch throughout this film. I'm very disappointed in this movie as I expected huge things and really looked forward to it but my expectations were shot down and I didn't really enjoy this at times. There was some good moments at times but overall I didn't really like this one.

Bad writing, full of cliches, some scenes are just plain stupid. The expectation from title or trailer is that this is a post-apocaliptic movie set Jurassic Park universe, but in reality this is bad spy movie, with dinosaurs as motorcycles and rogue agents. This is a perfect example of how you could ruin a beloved and nostalgic universe. If it was up to me writers and producers of this movie would never get another job in film industry. Disgrace! All of the stars in the movie can't do anything, can't save it. There is lack of logic in every event that happens in the movie.Like, one in the beginning, the girl gets scared of the raptor outside the house, literally 2 minutes after she grabs her bike and goes to ride.Also world where dinosaurs and human are roaming the earth is too calm. Seems like this movie was made by radical creationists who teach kids that Noah had dinosaurs on his arc.

I don't agree with people who nitpick. The movie delivered everything you want in a movie. It's entertaining, exciting and contrary to many movies today, actually has an ending. We left the theater happy to have spent the time watching this. Highly recommend and I don't say that lightly.

Some of these reviews, I can't seem to fathom or understand. I just watch the movie, and I seemed to have enjoyed it. I wasn't expecting it, as most were. I was surprised with how the director and writers of the movie were gathering most of the past Jurassic park characters together. That was fun to watch. However, what I was disinterested about was the fact that the movie took nearly an hour to build up its action, which was half of its timing. However, that wasn't much of a bug for me. Nonetheless, it was a fun ride and overall, it was a decent movie. Don't listen to some of these reviews!! You enjoy it.
Jurassic World Dominion is a film with ugly dialogue and a really bad montage of the film. I didn't like the story, neither is the management of the characters. Disappointing.

Looking at how zestfully it demonstrates a broad variety of dinosaurs, draws forthright references to some famous scenes from the erstwhile features, and also the fact that they bring the original cast back, speaks a lot about their intentions thus, I can safely tell that more than anything, Jurassic World Dominion is a movie strictly made for the fans and fans only. Since this was presumed to mark the denouement of this decade-long franchise, this was rather an obvious decision from their end to bank upon the element of nostalgia for one last time.Not that I'm complaining though; as a fan of Jurassic Park and these wondrous critters in general, I couldn't have asked for more to be honest. Yet, my biggest complaint is that amid all this flashiness and showboating, the makers for whatever reason forgot to look after the core storyline. The plot is quite unstable, it is indeed inconsistent and is certainly plagued with an awful lot of expositions and pointless maneuvers. Most importantly, it doesn't seem to provide any of the thrill or the suspense a film of this stature requires or rather insists upon!

While some of the reviews are fight about plot holes and what not, this is a Dinosaur movie. We don't need Oscar worthy performances or solid story lines.We all have a child within us that wakes from sleep when we see or hear anything about dinosaurs.

I was so excited to see this movie and it was so, so disappointing. CGI was like a low budget indie for Netflix. Acting was the same... You could have gone out and gotten better performances from a high school production.The screenwriters should be banned from ever being allowed to write anything ever again. Ever.No story, terrible acting, terrible special effects... Only redeeming quality was some amazing stunts.What a disappointing end to such a great franchise!

Feels like a school team project where everyone did their part at home and then the team leader assembled the pieces one hour before the deadline... there was just too much people, too little dinosaurs and lots of unfinished stories, a very sad way to end a saga...the only fun part were the callbacks to the original movie..First time reviewing a movie üò¨

Most of the original cast is reunited, and they still sparkle together. Pratt and Howard reprise their decent onscreen chemistry. The special effects are bigger than ever, the casting is fairly solid, the audience only expects a mindless popcorn movie anyway. What could go wrong? How about a screenplay so convoluted, loud, and boring that the whole thing falls apart?Jurassic World: Dominion (JWD) is yet another example of how Hollywood is handing multibillion-dollar franchises to inept, unqualified screenwriters. Like so many other high-profile, big-budget theatrical releases and streaming series from about 2017-2022, the screenwriters don't seem to understand how real people interact with each other or form sentences. JWD is a collection of digital set pieces in which human actors spout one-liners while jumping away from CG monsters. Dialogue is on the nose and frequently describes what we already see onscreen. Stock villains from sci-fi, westerns, 80s action flicks, and spy capers abound. None of it matches up coherently.This nonsense can be fun when an overall story doesn't take itself too seriously (I actually enjoyed the incredibly goofy take on Kong-versus-Godzilla in 2021); but JWD takes on heavy-hitting subjects such as global warming, the worldwide food chain, a child's life, an important baby dinosaur, black-market weapons dealers, and -wait, did I lose you?Everything is loud! And important! Right now! Immediately! And just like a loud storm can eventually lull you to sleep, about 45 minutes into the movie, you won't care what happens; and you'll realize there's still 1-1/2 hours to slog through to the end.I gave it two stars for a handful of animatronic/puppet dinosaurs (always nice to see a real prop when the other dinosaurs look like cartoons), plus a clever throwaway gag involving the original cast and a loud espresso machine.

Overall it was decent and I enjoyed the old cast meeting the new. But it felt very underwhelming with the plot and action. I think more time was spent trying to do all the storylines rather than more creativeness and action.

Any movie that bombs is ad FREE on so Prime which refuses to stream ad free generations old films, i.e., first Jurassic Park trilogy, first Star Wars trilogy, Matrix trilogy, bw 12 Angry Men, Sound of Music, Pixar shorts Piper, Rebecca bw, any good Marvel comic film, Markeet Manor, any BBC earth nature series.This disastrous Dominion film still streams ad free continually about 6 months after its theatrical release, not just for holidays. Nothing rings true in zero plot film that drags for over 2 hrs & 40 minutes, Dr Alan Grant, world's leading dinosaur expert is no longer an expert. Instead, the Dino expert is young black female pilot who works for criminals in well-known "underground" dinosaur black market. She nows dino scientific names, behaviors & how to fight them off more than anyone else, & despite being a mercenary, she suddenly does everything for free for complete desperate strangers.MSome scenes are utterly comedic, i.e. Chris Pratt herding huge dinosaurs on horseback and wrangling them with 1 horse & regular rope, like a cow, instead of being rammed or crushed to death. Dr. Henry Wu who throughout the first 5 films consistently states his meticulous DNA innovations is the "foundation of all things jurassic," is now a hapless regretful hippie, and supposedly did nothing, all dino research is credited to the long deceased, Lockwood daughter, who cloned herself while curing an incurable disease in her clone, yet failed to cure herself despite having identical genes.Fallen Kingdom is ridiculous because the clone daughter released all vicious flesh eating dinosaurs into the world after personally escaping death multiple times. She frees all dinos into SF, right after escaping being eaten alive, yet displays no remorse for the certain countless gruesome deaths she inflicts onto N California area, in both ppl & non ppl. Yrs later she stands by her decision as globally all ppl & animals become Dino food.This last Dominion film is much worse than Fallen Kingdom if one can stay awake after 20 minutes. Complete waste of time & humiliating end to what started as one of the greatest film franchises, 1st trilogy still entertains today, esp the 1st film.

Love the content and the graphics of the movie, this one has a whole different experience compared to the other Jurassic World movies.movie was so utterly predictable it was a little painful. Luckily the nostalgia nods were sprinkled throughout and mostly not forced. You can tell they tried to have some funny one-liners which fell flat a lot of the time. They need to take some notes from Marvel on those. The CGI and action was as good as you'd expect and offered favorable intensity. The story itself was somewhat lazy IMO. Did I mention it was totally predictable?

I really enjoyed this movie. I went to see it with my cousins a couple days ago, and I liked it.However, it's just too predictable. I always knew what was gonna happen a minute before it actually did, taking away the charm that this movie was supposed to have.

Grasshopper... that's all I have to say.It tells me the review needs to be 150 characters so, I'd say this is the 4th to 5th best Jurassic movie there is. If you want to watch a movie about dinosaurs this isn't the one.

To start with the 5 main cast members seemed to be paying tribute to the franchise and banking their cheques rather than adding anything new. Jeff Goldblum was especially guilty of this and at times you could almost imagine he was merging his character from Independence Day. The bright spots in the cast were DeWanda Wise as Kayla and Isabella Sermon as Maisie who brought freshness and some multi-dimensionality to their characters.The story seemed to have been patchworked together from a series of unrelated set pieces and the whole of the Malta segment could have been missed out without impacting the story, saving about 15-30 minutes of the running time.Plot lines seem to have been cobbled together from a random selection of films, leaning heavily on Schwarzenegger's Commando and Predator, but with a bit of Alien thrown in and a major homage to Indiana Jones, plus a bit of the James Bond Tomorrow Never Dies with the motor cycling segment.However, saying all that the film was unadulterated dinosaur fun despite it's predictability and lack of story telling. It finished off the franchise much as the Rise of Skywalker did to Star Wars, but does not leave you wanting more.As a final comment, I saw Jurassic Park in Reykjavik with Icelandic subtitles in 1993, and this is the only other one I've seen in a cinema. If was on a small screen I would not have survived to the end.

Too much of everything. Too much political drama, too many dinosours everywhere, too many characters that you are supposed to care about (but you don't). It would have been better to kill a few of them off early on to add some tension.Because the dinosours are everywhere it has a numbing effect and you don't even care when they appear.The kid is super annoying. The only positive thing about the movie is all the beloved characters from earlier movies including Dr. Grant and Ellie (although neither can save the movie). I wish the movie had just mainly focused on these two and Ian, it would have been enough and added nostalgia.This was by far the worst of the franchise I would say. All the other movies were at least OK, I've even seen all of them at least once in spite of serious flaws.

They try so hard to make it more exciting, complex and fun. But sorry it's confusing. To put old cast with the new ones is a good idea but the story is not strong enough to make me believe that they belong together. It's just weak!!!
Lots of suspense beginning to end. Funny parts too. Came in with low expectations because of the reviews, and was pleasantly surprised. Will definitely watch this one a lot with the fam.

Who green lit this crap? This is not the Jurassic Park/World we all know and love. This is some CIA operative action flick with underground dinosaur markets and new terrible characters that make no sense. Yes, they bring back the old characters, but they are used in a completely different type of side story. The "bad guys" are an added part that just take over the story. So this movie is less about dinosaurs and more about bad people trying to take over the world. Nothing saves this movie. I am so glad we watched this when it was free cause it's absolutely terrible! Don't waste your time. Just to reach the max words needed, again, it's terrible!!

It seems they are trying to see how long they can keep this story going.
