The story line was OK, bringing all the past and present together seemed to struggle to find its cohesion throughout the movie, at times it felt to be two different movies with the old cast and new cast in the same studio on different sets with no barrier. It's hard to rate visual effects anymore with technology what it is, everyone has almost the same skill set, so you have to come back to the story and the actors telling it. I give it a 7/10 only because of the Jurassic franchise as I've always been a fan. Just feels like they could have done better.

Not quite sure what people are expecting when they go see a movie about dinosaurs running wild in the real world. I've loved this franchise since I saw the original at 10 years old and being able to take my son to his first movie might make me a little biased, but I loved it more than him. That has everything you want in a summer block buster. Great set pieces, mediocre acting, and dinosaurs fighting each other. Of course it's stupid. Of course it's campy. Of course it's cheesy. Have you not seen any of the other ones for the past 30 years?I made the mistake of looking at the reviews before hand and thought I was going to be wasting 2 hours. Not only would I have loved it solo, but I made a core memory for me and my kid. I'm sure if I spent hours afterwards analyzing the plot and the character arcs I would feel the same way, but I don't do that with movies starring Chris Pratt. If you like dinosaurs or any of the Jurassic Parks/Worlds, see this. There are a few throwback jokes to the original which make it all worth it for the old crowd and my five-year-old was at the edge of his seat the whole time - probably because he had to pee, but more likely because of the Giganotosaurus and Quetzalcoatlus. See the movie. Enjoy yourself. And for 2 1/2 hours try not to think about the chaos that we are actually living in.

If you were asked to guess the plot of this movie by watching the last 5 minutes off Fallen Kingdom, you would stand no chance.I thought we would spend the film with dinosaurs running riot on earth. Ruining towns, attempts at domesticating, things like that. But no. Instead we get like a spy movie?Is it nice to see the old characters? Sure but because there are two groups on two completely separate "missions", it can feel lob sided and underdeveloped. Crisp Rat and BDH literally spend the whole movie journeying to their destination. That is there plot. "Take plane....arrive at climax". They may as well have not been there.Also the CGI just looked bad. It looks like cartoons. Like Dinosaur King. Just look at the first Jurassic Park movie, the dinosaurs look so good, they feel real, but I never felt like we're are real here.

I will say this movie doesn't fail to keep you entertained with the entry of so many new dinosaur species. I would say that this movie is still pretty good apart from having a few corny bits sprinkled in.

We enjoyed all the other Jurassic park and world movies, this one was not the same standard at all. So drawn out, two stories in one bringing back the original characters. Kids were bored, people were leaving the cinema, wouldn't recommend.

As someone who has read Crichton's books, (darn near all of them, still haven't read Airframe), this movie was all the things. Wrap it up, full circle, deep commentary on the scientific power we wield as humans with both miraculous and disastrous consequences. This is not a crowd-pleasing, no need to think, monster-action movie. Which is something Michael Crichton's original novel was never meant to be. At long last, the second franchise finally got back to the roots of what the books were really about. And I loved every second of it.

It's absolutely unwatchable. Scenes alter with no logical storyline, original characters are introduced like in a '90s sitcom, it's a new era of Jurassic World where we all live together, and it just does not make any sense. It feels like something made this movie, and it wasn't a human being. Like a deep fake.It is worst than the first Jurassic World film, and that one was pretty bad. Pratt is below average in both.I'd rather rewatch Spielberg's original masterpiece, or reread the book. Or just sit and stare at the wall.

This is my least favorite of all the Jurassic park movies. There are some scenes i could say are great but that's all, only some scenes, I thought because it was last one they could it did something amazing like other franchises but I was so wrong.
The best thing I can really say about this movie is that isn't as bad as the previous one... It's just a passable action flick with a pretty weak story and an uneven pace.

This must be one of the most stupidly misconceived big budget films I've ever seen. A storyline that actively resists your interest, even though you know that there will be dinosaurs. Direction so incapable, it feels like it was mixed live like some kind of dinosaur concert. No doubt there were countless talented creatives involved in this mega-production, its just unfortunate none of them were at the very top.

This is high budget movies so I expected more from this movies. Quite disappointed. This story is predictable and not suspense much like previous sequel. However still good acting and props. Maybe scriptwriting need to improve storyline so not so clich√©.

This is one of the worst dinosaur related movies ever. This movie is like bland mashed potatoes and analy destructive spicy food at the same time. It feels like they made this movie for brain dead people and they filmed this only on Monday mornings when all the people involved had a hangover.

Boy is it a confused film. Not because of the storyline, but because it is genuinely all over the place.There is good: the original and new teams in the same film. A different premise, which sort of makes sense. Some heart stopping action sequences (with caveats). Certainly not boring.The negatives. Even more preposterous than it should be. Yes, it obviously IS preposterous, but some of the occurrences are laughable. Some of the action is painful. Claire doing Jason Bourne over the rooftops? Oh well, no high heels. Some great CGI, some not so much. Tbh the ORIGINAL cgi was more believable.Perhaps just too much, all in all. 7 May be generous, but the excitement just about makes it worthwhile. The original Spielberg is still by far the best, by a big margin.

I mean, I get how cool "dinosaurs in a car chase in a city" sounded but it just didn't work. There were a lot of places where I could tell the director thought I would be overjoyed with nostalgia but nothing felt earned. I thought Chris Pratt barely got the raptors he trained for years to stop with his magic had motion but suddenly it works in every dinosaur on planet earth?The story was so weak I'm surprised anyone thought it was worth making. Oh wait, no I'm not, it seems like executives heard nostalgia and thought "nostalgia equals money and we love money." Well, I like good stories. Too bad you didn't try for that.

Epic finale for the Jurassic Park franchise! Everyone has their opportunity to shine in this romp of a movie. Couple characters from the last movie fell by the wayside which is understandable given the triumphant return of the original cast. Viceral action sequences. The cgi was great. Loved the scale of this movie as everything comes full circle. I really enjoyed it.

Pros: The second half of the film was really fun. The OG cast was awesome. The effects were good.Cons: The current cast got progressively worse as the film progressed. The first half of the film was mainly nonsense and really dragged by. The conclusion was honestly lame for a trilogy finale.Also: The Dilophosaurus still horrifies me like I'm rewatching the original Jurassic Park.I've seen worse, but definitely have seen better.6/10.

A lot of apologists for the previous Jurassic World movie, assured people that it was just a "bridge" movie. "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom" may have been a bad movie, but it was doing the leg work so that we'd finally get the movie where dinosaurs are loose and running amuck around the world. That is what the series had been teasing since "Lost World". That is what all the advertising for this movie promised. Those promos that Colin Trevorrow directed where dinosaurs were attacking at campgrounds and weddings. Finally, dinosaurs loose in the cities, not just confined to an island or reserve. So, what does this movie do? Start with most of the dinosaurs captured and put onto islands and reserves. The main villains of this movie aren't dinosaurs, they're locus. Why do you do this movie? Why do you lie to us?The movie follows Owen and Claire from the previous movies. Tagging along with them this time is the clone girl from the end of the last one. The movie makes the bold choice to make this clone girl an obnoxious brat that the audience actively roots against.The three "legacy characters" played by Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neil feel like they are in a completely different movie. They are in a corporate espionage movie and Chris Pratt and them, are in a jungle survival movie. Despite what the marketing may imply the two groups don't spend much time together.This "Jurassic World" franchise has been a mess. Characters act completely different from movie to movie. The plots don't seem to have any coherent narrative through line. The dumb rules they make up for these dinosaurs change from movie to movie. But the dinosaurs look pretty cool.At this point the movies are passed the bad of being funny bad, they're just depressing bad.

The Jurassic Park movies used to be about cracking boundaries, whether that was by scientifically bringing back dinosaurs, or showing us that we can enjoy a movie about monsters eating people whilst still feeling small and real and have that out of worldly feeling. I'm afraid in this instalment, the only new ground being struck is the fact that we see all of these beloved characters interact together for the first time, and then appropriately be chased by dinosaurs.

I had a tooth extraction yesterday and I had a better time at the dentist than watching this film. It's that bad, how did the stars agree to such madness...save your money don't waste 2.5 hours of your life.

This was pretty much a copy of every other film in the series but not as fun as most. They put just about everyone who survived all of the other films into one. They were cutting between at least three groups or individuals in the middle act and by the end, there's nine people running to get off the island. It was all a bit much.

Sorry, this is just awful. The story line and plot are just bad. It is unfortunate, because it had a really great cast and a lot of potential. It honestly didn't even feel like it was a film about dinosaurs. Too many subplots and pedestrian narratives at play.

Laura Dern and Sam Neill are terrible. Could have done without them in the movie. Dern gives the worst performance I've seen on the big screen in a long, long time. Her action looked forced and reminds me of a high school freshman in drama class. Sam Neil looks lost in all his scenes. Could have done without both of them in the movie.Jeff Goldblum was the opposite and made the best of a badly written movie. At least his parts were entertaining.The movie was disappointing for it could have /even so much more.

The basic premise that dinosaurs are everywhere on the Earth opened up an entire world of possibilities for the script writers and unfortunately they fell back into some very basic Hollywood themes that are no longer interesting and in fact are more often than not insulting to the audience.The legacy characters were so good in comparison that it should have been obvious to everyone the final movie would have been a lot better with just them with a cameo by Chris Pratt.To try and explain the plot would take six different reviews because there were basically six plots that are very loosely connected and mostly don't resolve. I could go into them and discuss them but that would mean I was putting more effort in than the screenwriters did.Since it's Hollywood in the 2020s, you know the good guys and bad guys based on facial hair and skin tone. As Quentin Tarantino has commented many times, we have regressed to 1950s style serialized television.Run from this one like you are being chased by a velociraptor.

I get that people are frustrated about revisiting old characters, but that's why I loved it. I grew up looking up to these amazing characters and having them be a part of what's new and to show how far the world (this fictional universe where Dinosaurs exist) has gone since the first park is fun to see.I loved that they had a new plot line that added back some different science fiction elements. They aren't terribly new plots, but they aren't necessarily the traditional Jurassic park plots. I am pretty sure they took inspiration from Christons other book Prey (this is a wild leap because I haven't read the book just heard the synopsis).They had action, they had humor, they had moral dilemma, they had philosophy, they had romance, they had familial love, they had science fiction and most importantly, they had loads and loads of dinosaurs. They even had updated ones using the most recent knowledge from paleontology.I get it was a lot of "fanporn" so some people are upset, but that's why I am giving it a good review. I LOVED it and it wasn't so overwhelming that it made the story horrible (like Force Awakens).I hope it gets some more good reviews!

I've seen a myriad of terrible movies in my day but none have ever made me so mad that I actually felt the urge to create an IMDb profile to write a review, this is that movie. It wouldn't necessarily be that devastatingly awful if it wasn't carrying the legacy of one of the most cherished cinematic franchises in history, but it is. It completely abandons the theme and mood of the original trilogy, far worse than it's two predecessors. It just simply follows the same 60% to 40% action-comedy split that every major box office hit now has to follow. It's all written for the exact same audience and at this point I'd honestly rather have something genuinely awful than generic as long as it was original. That being said, I am just talking about the dialogue for the most part. The plot definitely exceeds expectations of failure and laziness, but honestly after the 146 minute run time I truly lack the energy to express my feelings towards it fully. The only thing this movie really succeeded in was changing how I feel about reproductive rights. In the wake of this movie I have officially become a staunch supporter of the pro-life movement, I never want to have to see an abortion like this again.

Was it a bit corny? Yes. Was there a lot of fan service? Obviously yes. Was it a fun movie? Also yes. You can go in expecting a fun movie and not have the need for it to be a masterpiece. As a regular Jurassic movie, it would be great but as the finale, it falls flat.

We watched the first 5 Jurassic films and except of part 2 we enjoyed all of them thoroughly, so we didn't want to miss this one. Part 2 was a bit boring.I've read the reviews before we watched this film and think they don't do this movie any justice. Neither is the 6th Jurassic film boring nor is there a dinosaur attack every 3 minutes. People tend to exaggerate. Don't take them serious.Part 6 has Laura Dern, Ed Neill, Jeff Goldblum, and the two major actors from the previous films reunited and we also see Blue, the cute raptor. She now has a baby and the scenes with Blue and the baby are particularly touching.What I also enjoyed about this 6th part was for one thing the filming locations (Malta) and lots of new dinosaur types in close up scenes.Forget about all these lousy reviews, simply give it a chance and enjoy this truly entertaining movie!

How disappointing can a movie be, watch this and you will find out.Had great expectations for this, bringing some of the old characters back, but even that couldn't help this b grade (at best) movie.So many clich√®sand no real story.This really should now be the end of the Jurassic Park franchise.The first two with Chris pratt were enjoyable, but this is just absolute garbage. Nothing to do with pratt or any of the actors, it's the writers who should hang their heads in shame.

This was just too overstuffed, underwhelming and exhausting to have to sit through a 147 min runtime story that could've easily been told in 90 minutes. It was too much filler and not enough substance in between the UFC dino bouts, that it felt we were watching a five-hour movie marathon. Even the performances and actors' expressions when they were face to face with the dinos felt more like a Disney Jurassic Park themed ride promo commercial.

Just finished watching the film after reading so so many negative reviews about it over the past week. I went into this already feeling disappointed. But I've learnt a valuable lesson today - the audiences in this day and age are so hard to please, even if the original Jurassic park were to come out today people would probably give that negative reviews too.Don't believe what you read from the masses. I thought this film was excellent and was a great send off for the "world" trilogy. It gave me goosebumps, it made me feel wonder, sadness, surprise and fear. Sound familiar?? Another film does that too. It's called Jurassic Park.I'm by no means saying this film is as good as the original. But it is MILES better than Fallen Kingdom and I actually think this film merged the original cast with the recent very well. Both groups were integral to the plot and actually contributed. They used their nightmare experience from the first film and used it to survive.I could go on and write another 1000 words to this review challenging people who say "there wasn't enough dinosaurs. Too much focus on people" and to that I say - if that's what you want then go watch the walking with dinosaurs movie.. this isn't a Dino documentary. It's a science fiction film which involved HUMANS creating dinosaurs from DNA. People and their selfish motivations are kind of important to how the entire series has worked thus far.If you're reading this review and haven't seen the film because you've been put off by all the negativity - then please, go and see the film and judge for yourself. Don't be the negativesaurus that so many seem to be these days.And yes, I did just say Negativesaurus. I'm using it now.

The original 'Jurassic Park' still holds up as a genre landmark (the quintessential dinosaur adventure) and is still a great film in its own way. It has been years since seeing the two 'Jurassic Park' sequels, but do remember not caring for them all that much at all (especially the third film). The first 'Jurassic World' was a lot of fun, though with flaws, and actually liked 'Fallen Kingdom' more than most while acknowledging that it had a lot of issues and that it wasn't great.'Jurassic World: Dominion' did sound interesting and was over the moon to see the original cast reuniting. Despite all of that, 'Jurassic World: Dominion' turned out to be a big disappointment and was something of an uncomfortable experience seeing it in the cinema. To me, it wasn't terrible and not as bad as has been said by some with some good things. But there are also a lot of faults that cannot be overlooked, even when taking the film for what it is and what it was aiming for.Beginning with the good, the scenery is absolutely beautiful and shot with a lot of slick style and atmosphere. There are some good action sequences here and some inventive stunt work, the whole Malta sequence is exhilarating and when the film finally shows some degree of energy. Also standing out in a good way is Claire's very tense horror film-like encounter with the dinosaur. The dinosaurs look absolutely great and show a lot of personality, the predatory ones being very creepy.Some of the performances are good, a wonderfully sarcastic Jeff Goldblum and DeWanda Wise stealing all their scenes. Also really enjoyed the chemistry between quietly charismatic Sam Neill and perky Laura Dern, that evoked a lot of nostalgia. The music score is suitably rousing.However, a lot is wrong here. The script is far too exposition heavy and tends to over-explain, shining only with Goldblum's sarcastic quips. Plus everything with ByoSen is incredibly heavy handed and says nothing illuminating or insightful about corruption. The film is much too long, half an hour could easily have been trimmed which would have been achieved if the story got going sooner and if the climax was shorter. It also drags quite badly, especially the very slight and dully paced first act and the climax does lack tension and felt dragged out, was actually feeling the minutes rather than being enthralled. The whole ByoSen subplot feels like a different film and a marginally more interesting but still heavy handed and convoluted one at that, a lot of the second half does not make sense and left more questions than answers. Wu's part could have been left out completely.Did feel overall that 'Jurassic World: Dominion' could have done with a lot more tension and suspense and quite frankly the later action sequences did leave me feel exhausted and felt too much visually and audibly. There is no heart, charm or soul here, neither are there any brains, which play completely second fiddle to the big and loud approach taken through. The other performances do not convince, Bryce Dallas Howard does her best but has too little to do while Chris Pratt's frequently out stretched do all the emoting. Isabella Ferman came over as annoying and BD Wong is too much in Dr George Huang mode which doesn't gel with the rest of the film. Worst of all is an incredibly bland and a long way from menacing Campbell Scott as the very underwritten and afterthought-like villain.In conclusion, could have been so much better. 5/10.
This is a fun action movie with dinosaurs, however the politics of the films creators do not need to show up in every other scene of the movie. Other than that it's great.

I absolutely had a blast seeing this dinosaurs flick! It's heavy on nostalgia but it's fun! It was a lot of fun to see the mix of both the new and the old. I'm sad to see this series is over! Overall not perfect but such a awesome cinematic experience!

Three of the four stars are for Jeff and the dinos.I only watched this in the cinema because a movie group chose to but after the last two, i was not at all interested in seeing this movie.This movie was so......"White" all the supporting cast actors were BIPOC but the story focuses on some of the whitest white actors out there and while this wouldn't bother me so much, its a 30-year-old franchise and they are still so......WHITE!If anything, it's fun to see Jeff Goldblum be Jeff Goldblum and the dino scenes are a good time. Just download it.

I cant belive what im about to write,
so first off,before i will tell anything your about to think im dumb.this film was better then jurassic park. I know im suprise you.But this film just has it all
it end the trolgy and meybe this all frenchise in a very great way(no spoilers how!)
give a closer to most of the charecters,and wow mazy was totaly the best in this one she will be a fan favoriteif you wanna know i saw it opning day but frogot to reiview it
but anyway go to see
oh and aly satler and Alen grant were great as always
same owen and claire
but melcolm role here was felt kind small very sad he didnt got a big role but exsept it it was perfectrun!!

It is sad to see how poor in their essence, story, and execution the woke movies are. I struggled to watch this to the end. Same distorted narrative about negative vs positive characters that don't reflect any reality. The old characters are lifeless and it is easy to see they don't believe in the plot. I love Sam Neill acting but in this case it was pretty sad to digest his acting. The same has happened to many classics like Starwars. Matrix and others. They became unwatchable.Where are the Hollywood movies of the 20th century that were positive, optimistic, full of life, and fun to watch? I am actually wondering for how long Hollywood can keep this up until money talks and revenues bite. Good luck keeping the audience engaged with these fake stories.

I don't see why this movie gets so much hate. It is a bit of a rehash of old ideas, but it was always intended to wrap up the story. There were multiple story lines in different locations including the Mediterranean. The movie went in a positive direction, with a message about coexistence, which is a different take from the previous movies. The dinosaurs were stunning as always. The movie also had a lot of likable characters who made a lot of sacrifices to do what they think was right. I suppose people were expecting an apocalypse movie. Instead, it made me wonder if we should bring back extinct creatures and give them a chance in the wild in real life.

Stupid: 400%Acting: IshSoundtrak: hardlyCGI: SubparDialog/ Script: random wordsAction: Lots & lots & lots Everyone is a CIA superspy/expert in everything/ Science/ unarmed combat/ computers.Screaming: lots of it per usual.Dwarma: 1000% through the whole dumbassed mess!I would rather get sunstroke than watch this pile of dino dung ever again! & I thought 2012 was bad!

I went to see Jurassic World Dominion last night in IMAX and was surprised at just how much I enjoyed it. I wasn't expecting to like it, but I actually like it so much that I want to see it again on the big screen.Sure, the return of old characters are in place to give fan service to those of us who love the original movie. And ok, the story line is a little light. But if you can get past these 2 minor issues, you will really enjoy the movie. Laura Dern and the rest of the cast all look great, and Jeff Goldblum plays his best Jeff Goldblum since Thor: Ragnarok. Everyone clearly had alot of fun making this movie.The stars of the movie are of course, the Dinosaurs, and wow the artists and wizards behind the scenes really went all out this time. At a time where we are all used to VFX and where they can all seem kind of bland, Dominion really takes things to the next level. I don't quite understand what I am seeing, but the level of realism has been turned up to 1000. I wish I could describe it better.There are a few scenes which really stood out. A scene with Bryce Dallas Howard's "Clair Dearing" being chased though city streets and buildings by a Dinosaur, all seemingly shot with hand-held cameras, was especially well done.Anyway, ignore the haters and treat yourself.

Without a doubt the worst yet, something to surpass Jurassic Park 3 and Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom, this is the final nail. Such a terrible movie: convenience at every turn, shoehorned in political correctness, and nostalgia treatment of the lowest quality that tries, failingly, to bridge the plot and make sense of what is happening. From boring character to boring character, there was lots of nothing going on. A sad finale, though one that has been long coming.

I enjoyed the callbacks and the new stuff, I'd give a ten just for the chase scene that involved a Kei class van and dinosaurs, laughed a bit in that part and can I forgive any plot holes and supposition. Easy to watch and I'm glad I did.

I enjoyed this one more then any other sequal before this. It's got everything. The sleazy (Tim Cook clone) villain just nails it for me. The CGI effects are better then most of ot's current competition. It cotains some solid action scenes and a few subtle funny moments as well. Though it could have been a little better if they wrapped it up within two hours. It's just a little too long. And, though the story is a bit predictable, it's different from it's predecessors. So if you just want to enjoy yourself without expecting a believable or deep storyline then this one's for you! I recommand this one even if you only saw the original. It simply does the job in serving it's purpose.

I want to go to toliet.Then go home and sleep...
I have nothing to comment it.Just waste of money, don't buy ticket to watch...Not worth....
And i have to force myself to write 150 characters.

Jurassic World Dominion is an uninspired corporate product designed by a committee based on various graphs and research results from the test groups.They did the basic scheme of 1) Pour a lot of money into a known IP; 2) Dust off the actors from 25 years ago; 3) ...; 4) Profit.A very costly but uninspired undertaking. Only the product design team and the CGI crew showed their bests. The actors knew what they were getting into, and this shows. It's slow, full of cliches and self-repeats. Nobody is trying. The message the film solidifies in the end was already solidified in 5 previous movies.I don't want to dig deeper into this. There is no point. It bored me to death, and all the shots of the old cast with nostalgic music made me feel angry and manipulated. I can't rate this either. Rating this film a 1/10 would offend everyone who worked on it, but I can't give it more.The best thing about this film was that it created jobs and paid people for their work. Thanks for that.Not recommended.

Ignore the haters,it's not a great masterpiece but it's fun. I really liked all the Easter eggs and it was great to see the old cast back. Worth the money to see on the big screen. Don't understand the hate because it's non stop action and a fun ride.

This movie definitely has its strong points. The visuals are good, with the dinosaurs looking fantastic, and it's a real visual feast. The action, while maybe not the absolute best in the series, is still a blast and keeps things exciting. The performances are solid, with Isabella Sermon stepping up her game from the last film, and Jeff Goldblum adding a dose of humor. Plus, the nostalgia factor is pretty sweet, and the movie keeps a good pace to keep you entertained.However, the weak link here is the story. It's not terrible, but it doesn't quite live up to the potential set by the previous film. The villains are a letdown; they lack any real threat and are easily forgettable. The narrative can feel all over the place as it jumps around from one place to another. So, overall, it might be the most disappointing entry in the series, but it's definitely not the worst thanks to its strong visuals, fun action, solid performances, and that touch of nostalgia from the series.

The previous films never held a candle to the original but they nevertheless had a cohesive plot we could grasp and follow the characters as they progressed through the dangers of Jurassic Park. I cannot say the same at all about this film. This film has more plot holes and poor character choices than a Steven Seagal film, it makes Jurassic Park 3 look like Citizen Kane. Bringing back the old characters felt more like window dressing out of nostalgia for the 1993 film rather than make them important characters in this film.

The movie is a 6 however one has to acknowledge the skills and hard work of those involved with creating this visual masterpiece. The story wasn't much but I suspect the makers had a larger audience in mind considering school's out, and kept it simple.

The first half of the movie is a mishmash with too many characters and too many storylines to follow. I wanted a family movie, not a B-rated spy action with some dinosaurs on the back.C. I. A. vs. Mercenaries vs. Other mercenaries who hire more mercenaries... My 7yo watched the motorcycle chase with zero interest and finally asked "wait, who's chasing who again?" My 14yo just gave up, and reached for her iphone.Oh, and let's throw in some old characters into this mess. Because fan service. Cha-ching.It gets better in the second half of the movie, where it all goes back to the "nature + adventure" format. But overall it's still a disaster.P. S. Jeff Goldblum still rocks though.

Jurassic World Dominion is a different film, to say the least.I was so excited for this movie and the hype was so big. The trailers showed dinosaurs around the world and a rescue mission, again. But I was so delusional and thought it was gonna be pretty good. And I walk into the theater, on my birthday, and I'm still sort of shocked. We got a film about genetically modified locusts, cooperate espionage, CIA missions to save a annoying girl and a raptor apparently? You made a promise to a dinosaur? Oh yeah, and there's the hamd. Wanna see a 7 inch hand to calm every dinosaur in this entire FILM?! Well, here you go, it works on wild parasaurs, 20 feet tall carnivore dinosaurs, laser guided raptors, and on a mindless baby raptor and blue. The pacing is dogwater, screenplay/ dialogue is absolutely awful, and there is too many locusts to fill up the conspiracy theories. But I did like the Freddy Krueger dinosaur scene with Claire, best scene in the movie. Like the cowboy dinosaur scene, just ignore the stupid hand, it adds emotion. I love the old cast returning. Jeff Goldblum steals the show. Ramsay Cole is a ok Jeff Goldblum, Kayla Watts is a decent character, apart from being a LGBTQ. The swimming dinosaur in the frozen lake scene is good, just isn't Owen gonna freeze from it. I love Biosyn valley, I just hate the Biosyn building. I love the CGI in this film and the cinematography is good and real enough. The extended cut is a slightly better than the film, but still a bit disappointed by this Jurassic film. But as a fun movie to turn your brain off, it's perfect to get the nonsense away from you.

Remember the scene with the Brachiosaurus in Jurassic Park? Remember the sense of wonder and excitement you felt? How about the horror and anxiety you felt when the Velociraptors were stalking the children in the kitchen? There is nothing like that in this corporate, bland piece of uninspired trash they call a movie. Somehow they managed to make dinosaurs uninteresting and boring, while completely squandering the talent of Jeff Goldblum, Sam Neill and Laura Dern. It really is a remarkable feat. The film feels like it was designed by an AI. It is a vacuous, empty, soulless experience that absolutely defecates all over the legacy of Jurassic Park and why people loved it in the first place.The writing is abysmal. Locusts and genetically modified children take center stage while the dinosaurs are reduced to flashy CGI showpieces that occasionally pop out to eat somebody or menacingly stalk the main characters before they are tamed by Chris Pratt's magic hands. The entire Malta scene was basically a Mission Impossible knockoff complete with some snazzy British villainess and a car chase. It felt so utterly out of place. Unfortunately once all the main characters get to Apple HQ... I mean Biosyn, the film gets even worse. The entire film feels weightless and empty. There are no stakes, the audience doesn't care about any of the two dimensional characters that are introduced and nothing feels earned. There is no sense of urgency or danger because the movie is too cowardly to kill anyone or put anyone in actual peril. Trevorrow then desperately tries to cram mindless nostalgia down your throat in an effort to mask his horrible film making and complete lack of originality.Some of the dinosaur scenes are cool, but this film just feels like a celebration of mediocrity. The original cast are reduced to parodies of themselves while all the interesting and thought provoking ideas from the first film are thrown out the window in exchange for some mindless plot about GMOs and giant insect swarms. Jurassic Park was good because it was intelligent. It was thought provoking. The dinosaurs were shown sparingly, and the scenes with the human characters were equally as important and interesting. In comparison, Dominion is stupid, bland and unoriginal, and makes Jurassic World look like a masterpiece. And what a waste. The Jurassic World Series had so much potential and it was utterly squandered.I can't even recommend this film as a 'turn off your brain and enjoy the special effects' kind of movie like Transformers or Fast and Furious. This movie is utterly uninteresting, and no amount of CGI dinosaurs can save it from being a total waste of your time and money. It is a Frankenstein Jurassic Park drained of all the magic, warmth and charm of the original. Skip it, and watch the dinosaur scenes on YouTube.

What is with the reviews? Movie was quite good! Dinos were awesome and terrifying! Loved seeing all the main characters come together. Story was insane, but at least better than Fallen Kingdom. Served it's purpose to tie together all of the excellent Dino scenes.Reviews are not fair at all. Movie isn't not a 10, but it's an easy 8 for the excellent Dino scenes!Get Jurassic to the theatre, it's the only way to see this one!

I didn't much like "Fallen Kingdom". I thought that it replayed the various facets of the series that we'd seen before, just in a remixed fashion. I did say that I though that the ending might tease a possibility of something a bit different for the next film. It did, a bit, and whilst I wouldn't say Dominion was a good film, I don't think it's as bad as the last one, or as the critics have generally suggested.With the technology of dino genes now in the hands of Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) and his company Biosyn, the world has come to an uneasy alliance with the escaped dinosaurs now forming part of everyday life. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) is investigating a swarm of giant locusts, that are threatening the very ecostructure of the planet and believes that Biosyn are involved. She convinces Alan Grant (Sam Neill) to join her on a visit. Biosyn have never stopped looking for Maisie Lockwood (Isabella Sermon) and when one of their spies kidnaps her, Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) undertake a rescue mission.I mean, just to reiterate, I didn't think that this was great - but I went in with expectations so low that when it turned out to be alright I was pleasantly surprised. The dinosaurs in unusual environment sections are interesting, particularly the scenes in Malta. Towards the end we settle back into more familiar environment, a "lost world" jungle setting and science labs. I thought the integration of the two-story strands was OK, and it was nice - if not particularly thrilling - to see the old cast and new interacting. The look of the film is good, with nice camera work and CGI creatures.There are aspects that I didn't like, particularly from the ending, without spoilers when the Dinosaurs of different species teamed up in the finale of "Jurassic World" I thought it was a bit stilly - and I still think that now. I felt it was a bit disappointing when, given the freedom of the whole world, to go to a laboratory near a remote jungle. It's another organisation that thinks they can control nature but whose shiny facility is quickly torn to bits when things go wrong. I also cannot make myself care about the clone human storyline, sorry.Again, I don't think it's bad - just a bit too much stuff that you've seen before.

I am a huge fan of Jurassic Park, always been. The new World series was not great but it had it's moments with a descent plot and dinosaurs being in the centre. I was looking forward to Dominion. Unfortunately, the third and final movie does not deliver and probably is the worst of all. I am not going to go into details but it feels as if someone wanted to record a movie with dinosaurs but lost the essence behind it. The film has a lot of dinosaurs in it, multiple species, but the randomness, poor plot and lack of heart from the director make this a forgettable experience.

If you love Jurassic park, and know everything about it and will notice all the Easter eggs, from certain parts in the script, even to camera angles, you'll like, not love, but like this film. You can tell they tried really hard to make reference to the original movie here, which I appreciated and I enjoyed picking out Easter egg after Easter egg. Are there certain parts that don't make sense, yes, but it's Jurassic World, does any of it really make sense? Who cares, just bury the logic and enjoy the ride and have fun with it.With some great callbacks and final resolutions for some story arcs, it's worth a watch for any Jurassic fan!

"Jurassic World: Dominion" is the third "Jurassic World" film and the sixth film in the "Jurassic Park" series. Directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow ("Safety Not Guaranteed", "The Book of Henry"), it is a satisfactory conclusion to both the "Park" and "World" stories that should hold fans over until the inevitable future installments.Four years after the events of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom", Isla Nublar has been destroyed by a volcano and dinosaurs have now escaped into the real world. As a result, the future of the planet is in doubt since these once extinct creatures are reclaiming the Earth, making life increasingly difficult for all the other human beings and animals who are forced to co-exist alongside them. In an effort to curb this problem, a secret experiment involving more genetic engineering is underway in a secluded location, which, if successful, will allow humanity to regain its place at the top of the food chain and keep these ancient beasts under control.Since the release of the first film back in 1993, the "Jurassic Park/World" series has had an interesting run among filmgoers. The original featured groundbreaking special effects, a great cast of memorable characters, and that iconic John Williams musical score to help cement it as one of the most iconic films of the 90s. On the other hand, all of the sequels have yielded less favourable results in terms of entertainment value, ranging from decent popcorn flicks to downright insulting to longtime fans. It seems the one that started it all has simply set the bar so high that everything else following it looks so poor in comparison. After almost three decades, the story that began so long ago finally draws to a close here in "Jurassic World Dominion", which ends things on a fairly acceptable note.I've never been one to take the "Jurassic Park/World" films too seriously considering their entire premise is pretty farfetched. I mean, how seriously can you really take the concept of bringing dinosaurs back to life using mosquito blood and frog DNA? But despite that, I still find them highly entertaining for what they are, and that is watching dinosaurs wreaking havoc and exposing the hubris of humanity. I still remember being wowed by the original film as a kid and rewatching it as an adult made me realise how well it holds up today. "Jurassic World Dominion", which is intended to be the final film in the franchise to focus around the initial story set up in 1993, features all of this and then some, so if that's what you're craving, the film delivers just that.For the most part, this film's effects look pretty good but still not as good as how they did back in the 1993 film. This is because that one used animatronics for whenever the filmmakers showed the dinosaurs up close and CGI only for when they were seen at a distance. However, since the first "Jurassic World" film back in 2015, the animatronics appear to have been completely discarded in favour of entirely CGI dinosaurs, which I have mixed feelings about. Sure, some of the computer-generated dinosaurs seem naturally integrated into a shot but others look so obviously added in during post-production that they stick out like a sore thumb. I understand that it's cheaper to use CGI nowadays but if these modern filmmakers truly wanted to leave an impression on viewers, then they should have at least used some animatronics wherever possible.One major problem I had with this film was its bloated second act. Without giving away spoilers, all I will say is that there are three different stories going on at once, each with a different emotional feeling. For example, one moment we might see characters being chased by dinosaurs through a busy city street and then immediately after we'll see a slow paced scene of expository dialogue that feels shoehorned in there for storytelling purposes. These parts would have worked out better if they each had some kind of overarching link to one another but instead these weird shifts in tone causes the film drag at the most inopportune times. This is where I started to lose interest in the human side of the story and wished everyone would just meet up with one another already just to get things over with.I do think the film made good use of the idea of humans and dinosaurs being made to co-exist with one another. Some people are shown trying to rescue the dinosaurs to take care of them while others trade them on the black market as exotic pets. There are also a number of brief but well-shot scenes of a group of triceratops and elephants walking side-by-side along the African Serengeti as well as some large pterosaurs patrolling the skies of New York City, with some even settling nests on the tops of skyscrapers. I guess I just like seeing such a jarring juxtaposition of the old and new inhabitants of the world being forced to live in the same eco-system, but at the same time being reminded that this is not the natural order of things. It's like what Dr. John Hammond (Richard Attenborough) said at the end of "The Lost World: Jurassic Park" in that "...these creatures require our absence to survive, not our help".As a pair, both Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard were fun dual protagonists as Owen and Claire, but they are rarely shown doing anything solo in this film. Though I liked that the two were a loving couple at first, I would have preferred if we could have seen them do things on their own to allow for their characters to develop individually, instead of being two inseparable halves throughout most of the film. Additionally, the young Isabella Sermon felt like she was going to waste as Maisie Lockwood, the pair's adoptive daughter. Maisie never felt like an actual fleshed-out character but rather a plot device used to advance the film forward until the climax. It's a shame because I saw potential in her back in the conclusion of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom", but I suppose that was never meant to be.It was also nice to see the original trio of Sam Neill, Laura Dern, and Jeff Goldblum return after almost 30 years as Dr. Alan Grant, Dr. Ellie Sattler, and Dr. Ian Malcolm, respectively. Though their reunion here is based entirely on nostalgia, their presence at least helped elevate the film above what could have been a forgettable conclusion to this long-running series. Again, like with the dinosaurs and humans, I liked the juxtaposition of the three characters from the "Park" films with the new "World" ones of Owen and Claire. There was something satisfying about watching the five of them work together to outsmart the dinosaurs with their different levels of general knowledge in their respective fields, whether it be Dr. Grant's palaeontology or Owen's ability to communicate with Velociraptors.Although it's clear by now the series has run its course, I will admit that for all intents and purposes, I've enjoyed watching all six of these "Jurassic" films for the popcorn entertainment they are. Through the good and bad, I have nonetheless loved seeing how the filmmakers made dinosaurs live again and had them roar their deafening roars. But if you ask me, the series needs to go on a lengthy hiatus before we ever see these cretaceous creatures on the big screen again. Though knowing what a cash cow the franchise has become (like a certain sci-fi series set in a galaxy far, far away), it's only a matter of time before Universal Studios decides to milk it even further with spin-offs, prequels, video games, etc. Until then, let's just appreciate what we've got for now.I rate it 6.5/10.

Well, the idiocy is off the scale with this one...
The entire budget was blown on the CGI.. no money left for anyone to provide any guidance on anything remotely scientific and intelligent...
Multiple efforts to ram "the message"... down your throat are included as is the forced diversity resulting in unbelievable characters...
Yes, it is as bad as you have heard.., sorry...
Idiotic characters. Idiotic story. Lack of anything remotely close to logic
Watch it without the dialogue..
it makes no difference.

I love the original movie, and I thought The Lost World was a great sequel. While Jurassic Park 3 certainly has its flaws, it still felt like a "Jurassic Park" movie to me. I grew up watching these movies.Let's go back to the year 2015, after 14 years of rumors of another JP movie with the most bizarre concepts (Google them, they're out there) being tossed around, they finally landed on Jurassic World. I couldn't believe they finally figured out a script and production had actually happened. The movie was done. Finally!Well, after waiting all those years I went to see Jurassic World opening night, I couldn't have been more excited to finally see it. Was it good? Eh. There some moments that were good, but the overuse of CGI watered it down. Training raptors to follow commands? What happened to the blood thirsty raptors from the first 2 movies? Now they take orders from humans?Then we have Fallen Kinngdom. I really enjoyed the tension of the opening scene. The flash of lightning that shows Rexy sneak up behind the guy trying to close the gates was chilling. I thought I was in for a treat. Goldblum is wasted in a 4 minute scene... It turned into some convoluted hybrid mess with a terrible subplot to set up for Dominion.Now, we finally get this supposed "epic conclusion" to the franchise that brings back Grant, Sattler and Malcom combined with our new "heroes" and it all sounds good on paper. What we have instead is a giant mess of way too many CGI dinosaur action sequences. I thought Owen riding along side the raptors in the first World movie was bad.... Jeez. There are no great or epic moments, hardly any tension., it's just a bunch of computer animated dinosaurs thrown together on screen just for the sake of it. Unfortunately these movies get worse with each entry, and this is no exception. While we do get a couple nods and homages to the original movie, it just felt forced. Nothing about this movie felt genuine. Even the actors from the original trilogy felt like they were just bored.... And how many times are we going to have raptors encounter people just to have them stop immediately cause they someone put their hand up in front of them.I don't know, go see the movie for yourself, but don't expect any of the magic or charisma that first trilogy brought to the table. What we have is another watered down, CGI fest with no real emotion or thought put behind it. It just felt really stale. Fell flat on its face.

I went to have fun. It's Colin and millions of dollars. It should be good right....
The story was so convoluted. It was always tense and unease but no threat. It was bad dialogue by a grade actors.The cgi was hit and miss. Some was absolutely spectacular. Others stood out like a saw thumb. And the ending...... It was lack luster.Honestly wait for tv.

After the ending of the last film it left me and I'm sure everyone else very excited to see what the action will be like when the dinosaurs will roam the planet. Disappointingly there was hardly any action it was so slow and long that I was begging for the film to end. Save yourself time and money and avoid this boring film!

Look this movie like every blockbuster has its flaws but it's expected with these films. I'm a Jurassic Park fan and you'll never beat the OG but this movie is very entertaining and fast paced, probably too fast paced for some and maybe that's one of its flaws or pros depending how you look at it. Hopefully the extended version when it releases helps with that.But overall this movie is awesome, even after seeing it twice ü§ô

I don't usually write reviews but this movie was so bad I felt I needed too. I was extremely excited for this movie and I should have just walked out. I kept holding on that it might get better, it never did. This is on the worst movies I have seen in recent memory. This movie had absolutely nothing to do with dinosaurs, they were just kind of there while this script chased two different story lines trying desperately to merge them together at the end. Neither of which had anything to do with dinosaurs or co-existing together. That came at the last 5mins. Terrible way to end an otherwise outstanding franchise. Don't waste your money.

The film is not bad but it disappointed me. New and historical characters are not used convincingly, and history has bored me. A disappointing film that does not end the Jurassic World saga as it should.

The third and final entry in the Jurassic World trilogy and an overall conclusion to the original Jurassic Park series. A satisfying conclusion with lots of entertainment and thrillful moments. The best entry in the Jurassic World trilogy and I don't care about the unnecessary hate this film getting and I find it ridiculous because this film made especially for the true Jurassic Park fans.

The story is just another below average although the few actors are good. The special effect is just average but the stunts are poor.Directorship is below average this time.The story should be re-written because too common, nothing exciting. The director also did not make it good enough to be excited.I cannot give high due to the dropped standard from previous series. The most is 6.5/10 only. This is just another average movie nothing to get really excite and not worth top pay watch in cinema. I only recommend to watch at home with a small charges if you are a fan.

It's a shame they got all those actors back together to waste them on such a script.This movie is a total mess. First half of it, is wasted between boring teenage angst situations and useless scenes in some underground bazaar, where we are introduced to characters that we will never hear from again in the movie and that fulfil no useful role.When the movie finally picks up and we go to the company facilities, where we should have gone much earlier, the movie is again wasted in meaningless heroics, plane crashes without a scratch, swimming through freezing water and such goodies.In the meantime, everything comes too fast and too easy. Everything is there at the moment that is needed and every bad guy, and gal, immediately tell the truth about their purposes at the first question as if we just wanna move quickly to the next scene without adding any depth.This movie has too many characters. They try to give a significant part to each one of them and of course in the end this falls short, as expected when you stretch a script so thin.Maybe they could have saved it if they spent more time in the jungle as we all hoped, but no.This better be the last Jurassic park, before they go the fast and furious way.5/10 and that's generous.

I've watch every jurassic movies . I love every movies but there is one problem that is same story. I mean by putting og characters doesn't mean that "this movie best ever". Now , first I will talk about positive things . Nobody will gonna accept that it has very good VFX , it gives reallastic shot second new dinosaures and third that featuring kiddnapping of blue'child . Now , negitave weak polt , same story and predictable action and climax . So if you are interested to watch the flim , you can with your family and don't expect any new thing. I am thinking that the makers wanted sequel or for timepass.

Millions of dollars, hours, work, etc. To end up with this great ball of cliches... And it's even worst, mix and mush up; Jurassic Park, Indiana Jones, Impossible mission; Avatar, and many many others films: then you have this result...
Of course is mi absolute subjective point of view, but I wonder why Hollywood in the last ten or more years have decided to ruin almost everything that was built.

Don't expect a thoughtful movie. It's full of flaws and incoherent characters, but that's what makes it entertaining.Full of callbacks and fan service, very fun to watch as long as it's not taken seriously.

Reel Tunez Movie Review (6/11/22): "Jurassic Park Dominion".Not the best J. P. Not the worst J. P. But it does bring both the initial three and most recent two Jurassic Parks together and wraps up the series.It's cool bringing the original cast back together, and bringing them into the new Jurassic Park world.At about 2 1/2 hours, it runs long and is full of actions, screams, and loudness. It's a fun popcorn movie.. and the effect look good (though not further improved from the last two). It's worth seeing on the big screen!It does seem like they really chopped it at the last minute, almost haphazardly as a blonde villain character was on the scene, made a big presence, than just seemed to vanish.I'd give it about a 6.0 out of 10. Certainly worth seeing, but also it probably won't be the best movie (or even top 5) you see this year.

It's interesting how most of the 1 star reviews are very short, this says a lot, basically that we don't want this film to take up anymore time we wasted watching it.This movie is made for the late fans of jurassic park, the original movie has far more impact, the original movie has only 7% dino screen time where this film has about 80% dino screen time which kills everything about what jurassic park set out to do.The worst part of the movie is how much the director tries to tie in scenes and recreate scenarios and legendary moments from the original film. Spielberg did this because he is a fantastic filmmaker, this director did this to please fans. Nothing comes good from people pleasing in any situation in life.

Worst Jurassic movie I have ever seen there is an unnecessary dinosaur fight every 10 minutes and just when you think the problem is resolved another dinosaur emerges out of nowhere. I can't believe I paid to see that, I'd rather sit on the toilet and watch my pubes grow. I saw my grandad hack up flem this year and jurassic world domination is still number one on my most disgusting watch of 2022 list.Do not even get me started on the clone girl " Charlotte Lockwood" like don't get me wrong the acting must be pretty good because for me to be so physically angered by one character. Do yourself a favour and don't waste your money on watching it because now I have to waste my money on therapy after seeing that.

I was turned down by many negative reviews and almost did not want to see this movie.But in the ends its a pretty fun ride. The FX are top notch the story is somewhat, yeah we have seen it before but even then.Its not the best movie ever but its better than the last 2 Jurassic world movies.

Thats actually a lie.I love monster films,
REALLY LOVE MONSTER FILMS....what I get bored with is the constant chasing. And humans running faster than the thing that's chasing them,
And the LOOK two big dinosaurs fighting!!(again)Almost a GHOSTBUSTERS 2016,
'LOOK HOW GREAT THE ORIGINAL WAS',
lets bring the original characters, and plot lines, and more of the same,
But remove all the fun and thrills.The ending of the last film did set up something amazing.....
Maybe the writer director didn't watch it.

Ya the movie is kind of dumb and crazy, but also your on #6 of a dinosaur franchise. So ya things are ridiculous but lots of cool action and definitely better then fallen kingdom, that one's just dumb and not much redeeming in it.

Not scary, not even thrilling. There were kids in the theater and even they were bored.The whole point of Jurassic Park is the fear that the ancient predators are SUPPOSED to invoke. The terror from the original for me came when chars did everything logical and still got eaten. In this, you can out run raptors on foot, hide barely a inch underwater, slowly walk away from a dino as long as there's a car between you, and if you do get cornered without a weapon... just hold out your hand. WTF?! The writers have been watching too much How to Train Your Dragon. Why was the whole movie about locusts and not the dinosaurs?! They could've at least made them carnivorous locusts and had a scene where they stripped a bronto to bones in minutes. At least there's be some real threat in this pointless movie. I'm joking but it might've been a better movie if they took half the human leads out and had Blue the raptor fight her way through all the new species herself.Save your money. Gas, food, and tickets are too expensive now to be wasted on this movie.

The first one is still by far the best story of them all, and this one has a story I wasn't particularly interested in, but I'd feel like a total heal to rate this any lower than a 7 due to the effort that went into creating the incredible special effects. If it wasn't for those, this would basically put you to sleep, and I did find myself nodding off during one of the few moments lacking much action. But go into this to admire the artistry in the movie making itself, and I think you'll enjoy the experience. That said, I sure hope they don't make another one, because there is no more story to tell, and they've reached the peak on dinosaur action.

From the opening seconds onwards this movie is so so so bad and brainless. And it doesn't get better throughout.I seriously thought this is a parody. At least I had a good laugh over how bad this is compared to the original Jurassic Park.

Not wonderful but still a good, summertime movie and fits right in with the other five movies. Loved the callbacks to the other movies--you can't make sequels without having callbacks :-) Not nearly as bad a movie as all of these reviews are making it out to be; 7.5 out of 10 stars.

Jurassic Park was wonderful. Very good adaptation of Crichton's novel. The sequels? Meh and more meh. And Dominion is a perfect example of how Hollywood has *one* good idea and then beats it into the ground over and over because they have no imagination or creativity.The best thing I can say about Dominion is that I got to watch it for free, so I wasn't out any money on it.

There's nothing like what those former Jurassic Park sequels. Just hope this is the last. So hollow and pointless. So boring because there's no essence in this movie that's interesting enough to hold our attention. Is put up one hand with palm forward the only way to hold off the dinosaurs, a hand gesture these wild vicious creatures would recognize and start thinking "Hmm, that's an universal traditional friendly STOP sign so popularly accepted by our species not to attack?" "Are these human traffic cops trying to direct our movements?" "No Right Turn on RED?" This is one of the most boring movies so far in 2022.

Filled with characters and scenes to capture the nostalgia of 'Jurassic Park', but failed to succeed in the general feeling of the original. They couldn't even keep it in the same genre. 'Dominion' is a straight up action movie, just with dinosaurs. It's more reminiscent of a 'Mission Impossible' movie than a 'Jurassic Park' film. The original was actually full of suspense and terror, even a bit of gore. In this there is really none of that.Grant, Sattler, and Malcolm's return was the saving grace. And actually making Dodgson the antagonist was pretty cool as well. It was a showcase for some new dinosaurs, but otherwise not much else going for it.I will always love this franchise based on the original and how revolutionary it was in filmmaking. I've enjoyed the other films, they look amazing, and they have thoroughly entertained, including this one. But, I'm glad this is the end (for now), because the story telling has run its course, and you can tell it's exhausted. Possibly in 20 years they could look at continuing it in some way, but a very long break is needed.

A return of all the originals! What more could you ask for to wrap up the 2nd trilogy? Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum were my highlights. I'm glad it seemed all 6 of the main cast got equal screen time and it wasn't overpowered by the Bryce Dallas Howard and Pratt. TBH, I had completely forgotten the storyline with the girl but overall I thought it was a very fun action Dinosaur movie.

So, this is what trevorrow had planned out for years? The film is so bad it should be called "Jurassic whack." They really went downhill the path to follow Fast & Furious!!. I mean seriously? How could you turn one of the most popular franchise into disaster?Everytime I think they can they can't do any worse, yet they find a way to prove me wrong. Speaking without spoilers, this film have got almost everything wrong. Starting from the storytelling to the execution, even the background musics are bad. The first half of the film felt like rushed. Even the old cast members could not make it any better. Grant, Sattler, Malcom everyone is here just for the sake of being in the movie and they do nothing but crack disney jokes. Sometime I got confused whether I am watching a Jurassic film or comedy film made by disney.Finally, if we talk about dinosaurs, they had cool designs no doubt yet were looking so fake just like in every Jurassic World film. They main antagonist Giganotosaurus had almost close to zero screentime whatsoever. What was the point of making him the so called " The largest carnivore world has ever seen," if you can't give him a proper role? He did not have any sort of impact on the story.I won't go for other parts as it will make it too long. Just gonna put it right there. One last thing, I wanna thank Trevorrow for ruining my favourite franchise. You have done enough damage to the series. Now, please take leave and never ever come back again.

The film starts off a bit disjointed whilst it introduces (and reintroduces) it's characters. I must say it was good to see the original gang together again, and cool to see both generations finally come together towards the end, however by that time it felt like too many characters having to share the scenes.I'm so happy that they used practical effects and animatronics as well as the usual cgi and digital effects. The dinosaurs look just as real as anything else in the film. Great set design too.The big issue I had with this film is the overall lack of dinosaurs. In parts the film felt more like a Mission Impossible film or another generic action movie. Overall they reduced the dinosaurs to background characters.The acting isn't great, and Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard's characters don't have the same chemistry as they did in previous films which is disappointing. The addition of new characters in the final film felt pointless when they had characters from the previous film who weren't used in this one, that could have taken the place of these new additions.There was no real conclusion and this film ended in a similar way to how the previous one did. Some fun Easter eggs to please the fans but overall disappointing for what's meant to be the end of the era.

New drinking game idea! Take a shot every time Chris Pratt holds his hand up in the air and has a staring contest with a dinosaur. Guaranteed you'll be wasted within the first forty minutes of the movie. It was fun to see the original cast come back and it had some good dinosaur scenes that my little brother really enjoyed. Beyond that though, this installment just didn't do it for me, which is a shame because I love Jurassic Park and thought the first Jurassic World was actually very decent. But this one is way too long and drawn out, cringe writing at times, annoying characters, and strange pacing. The "villain" aka the guy who looks eerily identical to Apple CEO Tim Cook (did they do that on purpose?) was terribly written and completely useless. I'm glad I waited to watch this at home instead of going to the theater, at least that way I could doze off between scenes in the comfort of my living room.

We go back in time w/ Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum & Sam Neill joining the newer younger generation of Chris Pratt etc...
Lots of varied reviews on this, but all in all I think it's a success bringing both generations together. It's a dinosaur movie, goes a little environmental w/ locusts eating our food supply. Poor Campbell Scott is the muted genius villain. It's got some Indiana Jones style chase sequences w/ raptors & motorcycles & jumping onto a plane taking off. It's quite fantastical, but ya know, it is a dinosaur movie (I think they're actually extinct in "real life").So is the movie entertaining = Yes.Is their some good lines & humor (especially of course by Jeff Goldblum) = Yes.Throw in a little parental angst for the human touch = Yes.Do the big bad dinosaurs fight in the end = Yes.Is it a weee bit ridiculous = Yes.Is it somewhat enjoyable = Yes (if u're not a grouch or dinosaur elitist, lol).

Long, boring and predictable movie. Since Spielberg created Jurassic Park, no one has been able to go further. Same format, same stupid story, same gags in every movie. How boring!!! Who says that the dinosaurs every time they have to eat you, they have to mwttwrsi to scream like idiots ??? In the midst of an immense forest, how likely are you to encounter a tyrannosaurus? And to find 3 of them all together near the helicopter ??? In the obsession of surprising, in reality, you are bored. Everything already seen, reviewed and seen again !!! Do you want to surprise? Do something more realistic. These scripts smell of mold.

I can understand those who don't like the film as it's one for those who have been with Jurassic park from the start.I watched them all as they came out and went to cinema and for me this movie was great from a nostalgic point of view.It was fab to see the original cast and learn how they had evolved over the year and come full circle.There are multiple storylines running along side each other, the old versus the new, and yet these storylines are all running towards joining the old and the new together.I watched the extended version and feel like as a fan and viewer I've been given the perfect ending to a storyline I grew up with.

This was the laziest way to end the Jurassic 'World' trilogy.. such sad and poor writing. Nothing wrong with the acting obviously; when someone can't act in big budget film .. it's noticeable. Just a lousy way to end the franchise.

If you're truly bored and have 2h40m and want to poke fun, criticize, and be astonished how Hollywood can screw up a franchise, feel free. I would not pay money for it. I feel for those that did.I won't offer spoiler alerts. There's not much of a plot anyway. I will share, however, what I learned.If this evers come to life, we need to have and do some things. One, hold our hands up and palms out. Apparently this is effective and is understood by dinos. Two, have a taser and knife. These are apparently way more effective than guns. Dinos try to eat people in the movie, but they should not be harmed, right. Three, guns are bad, mm-kay? What a stupid, asinine place to put an agenda. It's a dino movie.Poorly done, Hollywood. I understand contractual obligations, but man, Pratt should apologize for this one, and the legacy stars deserve an apology.Burt Macklin would have done better especially without open hands, tasers, and knives.

"We're racing toward the extinction of our species. We not only lack dominion over nature, we're subordinate to it." Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum)Jurassic World Dominion may arguably be almost as good as the original. Anyway, it's quite entertaining summer adventure fare with the CGI dinosaurs more realistic than ever, including the biggest carnivore in the world, yes more fearsome than T Rex. The real dinosaurs are the returning veterans Laura Dern, Bryce Dallas Howard, Sam Neill, and the inimitable Jeff Goldblum. You just can't put them down even with the failure of at least two other theme parks.In order to fulfill the rigid requirements of the adventure genre, there must be a serious bad guy, and this Jurassic has Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott). He runs a sanctuary lab that houses homeless dinos but really serves as a platform for world dominion.You got it-the four heroes go through innumerable dino encounters to stop the maniac genius. But enough plot, of which there is nary a nuance, because the relationships of good people throughout are pleasantly emphasized so that we care about each one.We saw this Jurassic in a Phoenix Theater's Dolby Atmos, a splendid screening venue that titillates with sound moving your seat ever so slightly. When the dino stomps, our seats respond with a tingle. So, our Jurassic joy is watching and feeling the best motion pictures have to offer. Together with the most comfortable seats in town, it's a pleasant safari with monstrous animals, some over 60 million years old.The larger point writer/director Colin Trevorrow and writer Emily Carmichael make is about cooperation-be it among family and co-workers or dinos and humans, we have no choice but to work in harmony. Or otherwise, damnation it is or total annihilation. Having lived in the last three years with a microscopic monster, it's nice to see ones big as buildings with the hope that we will survive together, if only in the salutary world of Hollywood dreams.Jurassic World Dominion is a most pleasant way to enjoy a summer night out, even when it hints of extinction:"The doomsday clock might be out of time." Ian Malcolm.

Not a perfect movie by any means but to me it felt very true to what Jurassic Park is and it was a decent conclusion. They wrapped things up nicely for every character and let me just say it has some amazing shots.

RATED 7/10
Language: EnglishCompared to previous version, this one is little disappointment. But still entertainment to watch. The initial scenes and the dominion was nicely shown, after that it travels to the templated evil scientist and his money minded inventions.If they concentrated more on dinosaurs then the science, it would be sure hit. The dinosaurs become Pet and less dangerous. We can use taser to control the dinosaurs. And some scenes the GFX is clearly visible.One time watchable, if you are expecting pure masala action movie with dinosaurs....

So shoot me, but I liked it! It's apparently going against the general grain, seeing the many negative reviews here on IMDb, but to me it had everything to make watching this movie a rewarding and entertaining experience: apart from a few more talkative sequences the pace is mostly high, with many very exciting pursuits, the CGI of the dinosaurs is great (so I don't agree with the negative reports on that either), and the acting of all concerned is as adequate as could be expected.That doesn't mean that I didn't have some reservations too. Especially in the first half hour the number of different characters is too high, with a hard-to-follow and a bit chaotic story as a consequence. The music is at times so roaringly epic that it at some point became almost preposterous. I guess the oldies (Laura Dern, Sam Neill, Jeff Goldblum) had a ball being together again, but it felt a bit too easy, as if the makers primarily brought them in as a guarantee to skyrocket the box office earnings. Of those three, the only one that did add something substantial to the movie was Goldblum, with his priceless ironic ad-libs. But on the other hand Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard both were great again, and I absolutely loved DeWanda Wise!In short, maybe not the best movie ever, but still a nice and entertaining watch!

That was terrible!!Terrible story, terrible CGI, cheesy as hell and a total betrayal to the first 2 Jurassic World films and the amazing original Jurassic Park!!Whoever gave this 10 stars needs to get their eyes checked lol!! Please don't waste your time and money on this, if you're a Jurassic Park/World fan STAY AWAY!!!

Greetings again from the darkness. It's been almost 30 years since Steve Spielberg captivated us, and John Hammond (the late Sir Richard Attenborough) "spared no expense" in stunning Dr. Alan Grant (Sam Neill) with our first look at dinosaurs in JURASSIC PARK (1993). Best-selling author Michael Crichton's original characters and ideas have since spun off into THE LOST WORLD: JURASSIC PARK (1997), JURASSIC PARK III (2001), JURASSIC WORLD (2015), and JURASSIC WORLD: FALLEN KINGDOM (2018). We now have this latest franchise entry to cap off the second dinosaur trilogy, and it finds director Colin Trevorrow back at the helm. He also wrote the story and screenplay with Derek Connolly and Emily Carmichael.The big news here (other than the dinosaurs) is the 4-doctor reunion of Dr. Alan Grant (Neill), Dr. Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), Dr. Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum), and Dr. Henry Wu (BD Wong). It's the first time all of these characters have reunited since the original, and those of us who hold a special place in our movie heart for the transformative 1993 film, are most appreciative of the nostalgic touch. However, the hopes for a magical finale to conclude the franchise are dashed in the film's opening segment ... a cringe-worthy "news" report designed to catch us up four years after the destruction of Isla Numbar, and set the stage for what's to come.You might assume that dinosaurs roaming our planet would be the headliner, but somehow locusts get the nod. Well, they are genetically modified locusts threatening the world's non-Biosyn food supply. See, Biosyn is the evil corporation run by twitchy CEO Lewis Dodgson (Campbell Scott) that is attempting to control dinosaurs, the food supply, and even human cloning via DNA manipulation. It's that last part that brings Maisie Lockwood (an excellent Isabella Sermon) into the fold, and the DNA-mix also provides an easy punchline to Trevorrow's approach to this final film (blending DNA from the two trilogies). Maisie has been living deep in the Sierra Nevada forest with Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard). When poachers nab both the offspring of Owen's favorite raptor and his quasi-offspring Maisie, the hunt is on. The only question remaining is how are they going to finesse this so that the old crew (Grant and Ellie) collides with the new crew (Owen and Claire)?A stop in Malta to confront smuggler Santos (an impeccably dressed Dichen Lachman) results in the film's most frenetic action sequence. As Owen eludes trained killer-raptors while zipping his motorcycle across streets, alleys, and stairwells, Claire is sprinting (not in high heels) across rooftops like she's Jason Bourne or James Bond. While Owen and Claire deliver the heart-pounding action, Ellie has tracked down Grant on a dig in New Mexico, where he's "educating" a group of teenagers who remain glued to their mobile devices. Ellie convinces Grant to help in her mission to expose Biosyn, but we get the feeling he's making the trip for her, not to save humanity. With an assist from ice-cold pilot-for-hire Kayla Watts (DeWanda Wise), everyone ends in Italy's Dolomite Mountains at Biosyn's stunning headquarters. Slowly the connections become apparent, as it's Malcolm (Goldblum) who is the resident philosopher (all evil corps need one), and the one who has been feeding intel to Ellie.The rest of the movie exists so that all of these characters, along with Biosyn whistleblower Ramsay (Mamoudou Athie) can get in and out of trouble and dodge various stages of peril. The callbacks and nods to previous 'Jurassic' films are numerous. Some work and some don't. Malcolm's sardonic quips are mostly in tune, Grant's grumping and knowledge are spot on, and Ellie has remarkably little to do for someone who is responsible for one of the two main plot lines.
